description:
For a neighborhood place a block from our hotel, it was a solid place to spend a couple of hours. We did not try any games. Bartender (young white female) was very knowledgeable and helpful with the beer and bar snacks selection.  I would like to apologize to her for my husband seeming like he had a problem with our bill - he did not - he's a super sweet dude who has serious Resting Scowl Face. It wasn't you. 

A big screen behind the bar played awesome older movies. The music selection was pretty good (later in the evening, it went from being a nice mix of 80s rock and r&b to all r&b. I like both, but it was better when there was a mix of the two styles).

Clientele other than ourselves was very young, but not overly loud or impolite or any of the other things young drinkers sometimes are. Everyone seemed to just be having a good time. 

Bottom line, I wouldn't necessarily criss-cross the city to get here, but it was a great place for "close by".
author: Haltone H.

description:
A solid arcade bar in the edge of the Castro with lots of retro games, mainly pinball machines, some shooting and fighting games, and a couple random games. The most entertaining game I played here was the Killer Queen game which can have up to ten people playing at once!

The bar itself is okay, they only serve beer and wine (no cocktails), but the bartenders were really friendly. There's a machine in the back to exchange bills for quarters if you forgot to bring some with you.

Great place to hangout with friends and relax on a weekend night, especially if you're not looking to go crazy at a bar or club!
author: Kedar V.

description:
Located in a modern condo building, Brewcade is a bar with arcade games. Sadly in the Castro, but not a gay bar. The bar serves only wine and beer, with a couple premade/previously frozen food options. The games are fun, but nothing too modern nor too iconic. The games fit the ok to decent category. Some seating when not playing games, but overall a small bar. Service was friendly. Slushy drink was ok but lacked flavor. Some games were broke.  

Would like to see some more food options, more events, and ability to sign up for game play.
author: Alan H.

description:
Came here on a Sunday night during our visit in SF, because everywehre else was closed... It's a small barcade with some games, a bar, and a huge tv screen that was playing the basketball game. Chill vibes, however, the biggest issue I had was when we were trying to play the games, MAJORITY OF THEM, DID NOT WORK. I mean it didn't say out of order so we proceeded to insert our coins and then it would "start" but then the buttons don't work or the players won't move. It happened to us on a few games and we were too lazy to ask for a refund. Why have games that don't work?? and if they ARE out of order, then put a sign on there so people don't waste their money.
I obviously wouldn't ever come back and I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Katelin N.

description:
As an arcade, this place is totally on point. As a bar, it's super meh.

The game selection is excellent, with some pinball, some classics, some fighting games, a racer or two, and some shooting games. Even though they don't swap games out as much as I'd like, the ones they do have are always in working order. They're also not too busy; there's definitely an exciting atmosphere from the other patrons being around, but you won't have to wait all night to play a game you want.

Brewcade also has Killer Queen! It forces you to talk to strangers, but it's a hell of a game that will entertain you and your friends for hours. It's sort of like a MOBA, I guess, but without the rage that League and Dota are wont to cause.

The bar is just okay. The beer selection is okay, but nothing incredible. They have wine slushies, which are fun and unique, but again, nothing life-changing. I'm more of a cocktail guy anyway, and they have none of those.

It also gets bonus points for allowing myself and my mom to bond over old games from her youth, something I've very much struggled to do in the past. So I guess my advice would be to get drunk with your mom here.
author: Shawn W.

description:
Before the Coin-Op Game Room came here in SF, there's this original arcade bar that has started it all right here at the Duboce Triangle neighborhood. It's called, "Brewcade!" Brewcade serves the customers to experience their old school arcade vibes from playing classic arcade and pinball games to endless assortments of drinks from beer to cocktails all night long! The atmosphere is very active and on-going as I welcomed there. The concept is pretty simple filled with a combination of an arcade room and a dive bar; all-in-one. The decors is much modern and dark filled with hanging lights across the whole interior room.

The employees here especially bartenders are doing a great job for making the customers like me a remarkable and tremendous service despite the busiest environment. No cons.

Now onto the experience! Inside, they have good selections of well known arcade games from Super Mario Bros VS, Pac-Man, Ms. Pac-Man, Galaga, Rally-X, Rampage, The Simpsons, Street Fighter II etc including the mostly popular game, the 5-vs-5 favorite, Killer Queen! Pinball games are still there while entering the front door too! Games costs between 25 to 50 cents. How cool is that!?

As for the drinks. I did ordered one of their available brewery selections: the Ruhstaller 1881 California Red Ale. While I drank that beer, it tasted quite good for that Sacramento brewery's signature beer. Crisp and refreshing.

In some occasions, Brewcade has tons of video gaming tournament parties every year, so it's a plus for modern video gaming addicts to show how these participating teams will battle their fate. Fun and mesmerizing!

Parking at Brewcade can be challenging to park. You can park at the nearby surface street parking if it's available during peak times. Alternatively, you can ride a bike, walk, carpool, ride sharing or public transportation easier without the hassles and gimmicks.

All in all, Brewcade is the most incredible and interesting local arcade bar that I've ever visited for the very first time in San Francisco! Perfect for friends gathering! A well received and planning to come back for more! My rating: 4 solid stars.
author: William L.

description:
Quite the interesting fusion of an arcade and a beer bar that draws folks from all over. There aren't that many seats here, as the floor space is devoted to games, games, and more games, but the vibe is still boisterously social. There's also a surprisingly good, comprehensive beer list. Service is fast and efficient. 

Since it's about games, the vibe is different that it would be if it were simply a bar or a dance club, but there are plenty of those places in the neighborhood already. A welcome hangout and a nice addition to the area.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Honestly, to truly enjoy this place, you should get there early with a friend or two. On busy nights it gets wicked crowded, which can ruin its charm, appeal and your ability to enjoy it. 

That said, I have an affinity for Brewcade because it's where my girlfriend and I had our first date. We shared a few craft beers which were fun to choose from, since they're largely local and unique. We played the vintage arcade games (badly) but enjoyed every minute. 

Fast forward to my most recent visit, which occurred during Pride weekend whilst showing a friend from home around the city / Castro. The bartenders were all grade "A" cuties, very attentive and friendly with us being two of six or so guests. Working in the industry, it can be easy to take advantage of slow hours - you'll be on your feet all night and day interacting with throngs of people just trying to get drunk so you avoid when you can. I've seen it and I've been there, but these guys were the exact opposite. 

We had wonderful conversations with the guys working and even played a couple rounds of Mario Kart on the projector screen with them. I've always been a fan of Brewcade but this experience really made my friend visiting feel at home, and he raved about it the rest of his visit!

ANYWAY, on to the details, and if you skipped ahead I don't blame you. 

This spot serves up really delicious craft beer as well as a few wines on tap and a couple of sugary cocktails. It all fits the theme but I really appreciate their beer list since it's actually quite well put together. Anyway, prices can be a tad steep, but you're paying for atmosphere, fun, and craft beer, so can you really complain? 

They also do video game tournaments and movie nights, though I've yet to participate in either so I can't speak on them personally. 

At the end of the day, I dig this place, but I'll likely avoid it during peak hours and opt instead for a low-key afternoon or early happy hour to truly catch the vibe.
author: Alex K.

description:
Went here randomly on a weekend trip to San Francisco and couldn't have had a better time. Perhaps in part to the fact I had amazing friends w me, but overall the venue was great. 

First off, the service was great. I can't remember for the life of me the name of the bartender and bouncer that helped us but they were tremendously friendly and helpful. 

As an arcade, the place had less games than I was expecting but provides a wide range of classics, pinball, fighting, shooter games, and also a tv to play Mario Kart in (a blast, honestly). They also have Killer Queen, which I thought stole the show for the night. Luckily, we went on a Sunday which is a quieter night, and we had a ton of fun meeting other people playing this game. It was our first time seeing it. It's a fabulous up to 10 player vs. co-op game that lets you meet and talk to strangers and is endlessly entertaining. As for the bar, we really enjoyed the wine slushies, which were pricey for what they were but delicious nonetheless. 

Overall, this is a place I could see myself frequenting if I lived in the area, but for now I guess I'll just have to visit whenever I'm in town.
author: Victoria L.

description:
THIS REVIEW IS STRICTLY FOR THE ARCADE: 

So I went here with my boyfriend a few weeks ago. It wasn't busy at all roughly around 5pm. There was a quarter machine to exchange your cash, which was convenient. However, although they had a moderate selection of games to choose from, it either didn't accept the quarters I inserted or it didn't work at all. A little annoying, granted I could've used them for other games. Also, it's much more of a selection of retro games, which is cool if you're into that. 

If I were in the area, I'd probably go back later on in the evening and purchase drinks as well to get a feel for the overall barcade. The arcade, specifically, just wasn't as exciting as I had anticipated.
author: Rebekah D.

description:
9/10/17

Let's face it, the drinks here suck.  Okay?  Just gonna have to get over that... ..(I got a BC Paloma for $10--don't be me, don't get a BC Paloma.  Just don't.  You're welcome.)  BUT, good thing is they have a pretty decent beer and cider list.  So, if you're not feeling like drinking what tastes like the creation of a club catering to barely legal 21ish year-olds, then do yourself a favor and get beer.  Thanks.

After you got your happy buzz, then... then! you will appreciate what this place is really all about--your childhood memories at your fingertips, in your happy childhood delirium you always had then but never knew you had until you had-not.

For small bills or quarters you buy back your childhood one beautiful death by glorious death at a time... until you are ready to wander out the doors, seeing the world as you once did, full of wonder, ready to conquer whatever the f stands in your m f way

3/5

#arcade #bar #sanfrancisco #beer #pub
author: Dean C.

description:
Barcades are always a fun alternative experience to bar hopping or whatever. Also, I enjoy retro arcade games, sober or buzzed. Exchange a few dollar bills into quarters, grab a beer, then enjoy some arcade games (unless it's the weekend and every machine is occupied). If you don't want to play any games, you can always lounge around too!

Beer selections are plenty and the bartenders are very friendly. I was actually given a beer on the house because he claimed I waited for a long time. Frankly, I thought waiting several minutes before ordering a beer is normal but this guy went above and beyond, making my night all the more better (because how can you not enjoy a free beer?). The drinks are pretty standard so it may be best to stick to beer. The main attraction aren't the drinks anyway, it's the overall ambiance and arcade experience.
author: Derek T.

description: There were a few machines that didn't work and kept stealing my date's quarters! :-/  They should fix those... Joust and I forget what other game kept taking quarters. Other than that guess it was ok in hindsight. I'll probably be back. Wish there was a pool table.
author: Isabella A.

description:
Brewcade is cool, I went a few times and had a decent time. A lot of the games just aren't that interesting, it's a bit like stepping back in time but to the 80s, when games weren't quite that well developed. If you love retro gaming you'll have fun. 

The positives were the beer list and the wine slushy. Killer queen is also super fun but there are also professional players who drop in sometimes and kind of ruin things for the casual folks. Had this happen both times I went. 

Overall, a good place to hang out for a couple hours but I wouldn't make anjigyt of it.
author: Enrique C.

description:
I came here on a Friday night and the location is nice but the place was very disappointing. The place is small with limited seating and doesn't have many arcade machines which makes it hard to enjoy. They do have some fun games like Mario kart on the big screen and big buck hunt but it was hard getting on those since they're the more popular games.

Another negative is the drinks. They are licensed to only serve wine and beer and the one beer I had, blue palm, wasn't good. Their frozen wine slushie is their popular drink and the grape flavor was just ok imo. I like the idea and concept of the place but one visit is enough for me.
author: Steve H.

description:
I'd rename it Brewclub instead of Brewcade. There are tons of video games, but on a busy night the games are all being used and it's got the vibe of a club. Lots of "what did you say?" "Huh?" 

Get there early to hang and play.
author: Marc B.

description:
Quick stop for some pinball action, metal Slug, aero fighters,  and bust a bubble!!  So many old classic games here if you're looking for a fun play while enjoying a nice cocktail or cold beer! Definitely had fun playing childhood games. Also the winter Olympics were on the big screen!  So they have TVs all around to enjoy. 

The bathrooms were clean and well equipped. A big plus for me when going to a bar because I hate dirty and nasty bathroom. 

Only complaint for my short visit was both coin exchange machines were out of order. Good thing the bar tenders were able to us change. 

If you like classic games and want to grab a drink, I recommend this place. Definitely fun with a group too.
author: Lucy T.

description: Small, old but fun place. Few machines were broken but loved the wording board and the plays were not expensive. Perfect for team building!
author: Anya C.

description:
A blast from the past for game aficionados. An awesome place to get together with friends or even by yourself for a quick game or two on retro arcade games. Arcade games take quarters, and of course Brewcade has a change and ATM machine convenient. 

I love the decorations, the magnetic wall, and their beer selection. Bartenders were on top of all orders and I never had to wait more than a minute for some assistance. 

If you want to rent their locked up games or their wii all you have to do is check in your ID. Simple and effective way to keep track of their games. 

Food can be ordered on your phone from the restaurant next door. The secret food window by the pinball machines is awesome haha. We ordered two sides of fries and they were ready within ten minutes. 

Friday night we reserved a section for a birthday party from 6-8. When we first arrived Brewcade was quiet, but between 7-8 it became a full house quick!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Threw a goodbye party here. Brewcade has lots of beers and some mixed drinks. They also have a respectable amount of games, especially for the size of the venue including: pinball, classic side scrollers, and even a 5v5 game. I think this is a casual hangout place, great for dates, get togethers, etc., but it gets a bit loud sometimes. Brewcade now has food too, I didn't get to try it though. It's my go to arcade bar.

Service is really nice. You can book tables ahead of time and it's free, but they require a credit card, which they will charge if you don't show up. It can get kind of busy later in the evening, but it's pretty low key before 8.

Favorite beer is the:
hef
author: Sean W.

description:
Very cool spot! Lots of beer and mixed drinks selections here! It's also an awesome place for a date spot. 

There's a  good amount of old school games here from the Simpsons to mortal combat to even pacman! There's even pinball machines!! 

I would definitely come back
author: Caitlin P.

description:
Good selection of beer on tap. A good amount of arcade games. Reasonable price. Super Smash Bros competition on the big tv. 

It wasn't overly crowded on a Saturday night so my group of friends were able to enjoy ourselves at the tall tables. I appreciate that they have water on tap to the side of the room - lessen the hassle of having to ask for refills and good for preventing super drunk customers (maybe). 

I would definitely come back to this spot over the other arcade bars since it's a little less crowded.
author: Chariya S.

description:
Stopped by to kill an hour or two with a few friends the other day.  This place is pretty cool - they have a wide selection of beers and drinks, and they have a bunch of cool arcade games (ie. pinball, racing, shooting games, whack-a-mole).  I ordered a white belgian ale and it was solid.  The drink ran me about $8 including tip during happy hour, which wasn't terrible, but this also wasn't the best happy hour I've been to.  Their deal is $1 off, which is a pretty low discount compared to other places.

Service was great, and they also have a giant screen that you can use to play MarioKart on with your friends!
author: Tim L.

description:
Killer Queen!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Omg you can spend hours here screaming in excitement/joy/angst

The teamwork and competition is REAL.

It's always going to be a fun night,  I personally like coming later on days where it's not league night so I actually get a chance to play
author: Tina A.

description:
After having dinner nearby, my group of four wanted to do one last stop. After walking around, we decided to check out Brewcade on Wednesday, January 25th around 10:15pm.

*Anchor Steam: Anchor, SF, CA, 4.9% ($6)
*Witless Zombie Witbier: Blackhammer, SF. CA, 5.5% ($7)
*Mondo Pils: Temescal, Oakland, CA, 4.8% ($7)
*Boylan's Diet Cola 

I got the anchor steam as the giant colorful menu was a little overwhelming at first. I basically just picked the first thing that looked familiar to me. Although, thinking back, I probably should have gotten the witless zombie as I normally prefer Belgian whites. They didn't have mondo pils on tap, so my friend just got a can.

We walked around for a little bit to check out the games. They definitely have some throwbacks for me such as Paperboy, Street Fighter 2, etc. They also had a row of pinball machines. The most popular game seemed to be the Killer Queen. I didn't play it as there was a huge crowd in front of it, but I guess they have tournaments every now and then for that particular game. In the end, the four of us just grabbed a round high top by the window and chilled while we finished our drinks.

Fun place if you want to play arcade games while drinking. Not the biggest selection of games I've seen, but still a decent size. Next time, hopefully I'll play one of the games. I do miss going to the nickel arcade by my house back in the day. Definitely a little nostalgic.
author: Elena N.

description:
Cool spot, though we weren't able to play any games because we didn't have any cash and the Chase atm next door apparently closes at 11pm.

I had the peach wine slush and it was sooo good. But also $10.
author: Ellen J.

description:
Came here for a work outing! It was nice being able to make a reservation and have our own designated table area. 

Have you ever heard of a wine slushee?! Neither did I! This is the first time I had their Grape Drank aka wine slushee. There is multiple flavors like peach, watermelon, orange and OG and strawberry. I had the peach one, but I was disappointed that it was just original flavor with peach syrup. I did like they have a sparkling tap you can get yourself! Beats asking the bartender for water!

I played a couple games like Pac Man, pinball, Deer Hunt. Very chill hang out spot!
author: Frances K.

description:
I came here to meet up with a friend. I didn't get the opportunity to play any of the arcade games, but by glance there seems to be a good variety. I noticed a few classic and popular games, as well as some shooting games. They also have a good number of pinball machines.

Atmosphere was chill and lively. Staff was cool. There is plenty of beer options and other fun beverages like the Grape Drank. Parking was surprisingly easy and there were a fair amount of seating.

Overall, a fun and laid back place to hang out and grab some brew. Love the concept. It's worth checking out if you're in the area.
author: Julia L.

description: Small bar with some classic arcade games, that also holds weekly video game tournaments on the big screen. Ben, the bartender, introduced me to Gose style beers and they are my new jam. I described desiring a glass of wine, but being at a beer place = gose. Had the blood orange (local) last week and it was great. They always have a good selection on tap & food is right next store if you're hungry.
author: Alexa S.

description:
Gaming arcade + Beer. This is a very interesting concept and appeals to a large group of ages. 

It is accessible from the 16th and Mission Bart stop but is a slightly long walk or short uber ride from there. The bar itself has a wide list of beers which include IPA's, local brews, etc written up on a big chalk board at the bar. I tried the Temescal brew and that was not bad at all 6/10. The beers range from roughly $5.00 per glass and $28.00 approx for a pitcher of beer (5-6 glasses). 

Note : You need quarters to pay the games. You can get these at the bar itself. 

Also they offer a free taste of the beer before you get it so just ask. 

I am personally not a big gamer so I wasn't able to appreciate that part of the experience and felt that the bar overall is only meant for those interested in that to at least some extent. The beer was not bad and prices were good ( comparable to other bars) 

For me this is an ideal pit top on a bar hop night but not to let this be the only place you go to. It's also too loud to talk so sit and drink is a no no. The accessibility was also slightly an issue for me. 

The staff was very friendly and the bathrooms were decent to use too. I recommend it to people interests in gaming and beer on a decent budget.
author: Shivani B.

description:
Brewcade is a fun, albeit a bit small, bar/arcade located in the Castro. We came by on a Saturday afternoon and had a relaxed, fun time.

THE OVERVIEW.
- Parking can be a pain, but that goes with the territory of the neighborhood
- Good assortment of arcade games, including one that works best for large groups (so make a friend!)
- Coin machine available for anyone whose last quarters went to parking
- HUGE assortment of local beers, and a few solid in-house cocktails available, averagely priced
- Limited seating, but most people are playing arcade games anyways, so who cares!

The offerings at another bar-cade in the city are better, but this is still a solid place to kick back and unwind.
author: Claire S.

description:
This place gets a 3.5-4.0

Big fan because of the booze and video games but unfortunately many of the arcade games were not working when I was there. 

I love the idea of this place but wish they had more space. I know it is SF but wish they had more space and more games (wishful thinking).

I will definitely be back though for some good old nostalgic fun.
author: Derek F.

description:
Cool idea.

A lot of the games are pretty old school and they are all well played, so some of the joysticks and buttons are not as crispy as they could be, but it was fun coming in here and playing a few games before heading out for a night on the town.

I got slaughtered a few times in Capcom vs. Streetfighter, played some tetris, then called it a night since we couldn't get on one of the shooter games.

They had a full bar there, but I was stuffed from dinner and had no space at the time.

I'm not up on killer queen, but supposedly it is the $#!t.  There were a bunch of guys going crazy over it and celebrating hard after victories.  I guess they have competitions on certain nights.  I'm going to have to do some research and see what this game is all about.  I can't believe I've never heard of it or seen it before.

It is definitely worth stopping by.
author: Ty C.

description: Stumbled upon this place while walking around SF. I'm glad we found it. Games were about $0.50-1.00 to play, many two player games. Sometimes the machine would eat my money, but it wasn't worth complaining to the staff about. That night there also happened to be a Super Smash Bro tourney. Overall, a great atmosphere if you're trying to drink, have fun and reminiscence on the past.
author: Katie V.

description: This place is so much fun! Went for a date night and only spent 20$ for about 3 hours, we played pretty much every game we wanted to. A lot better of a deal than a Dave and Busters and waaaaay better games. It wasn't too crowded on a Sunday night. The frozen wine is really good, and you can get it sweeter to your preferences.
author: Christina C.

description: Love this place. Awesome beers, great arcade selection. No bad vibes. They have Killer Queen, done deal.
author: Ryan H.

description: Love the concept and staff!! Great selection of beer and everyone was super friendly. I went on a Friday at 7 and found a great spot for the 4 of us. The bartender was attentive (Ellie was great). I think I'd like to go on. Not so crowded night to play video games
author: stephany m.

description:
This is the best arcade-bar in SF if your main focus is to play games.

Arcade games are cheap.

Downside is this place gets CROWDED. 

They have a large beer selection (with sours!) and they bus tables super fast. They have self serve water and sparkling water! 

Expect this place to be insanely crowded to the point where there's no where to sit and barely enough space to stand without getting touched every 5 seconds by someone passing by.

I probably wouldn't come back here but I'd recommend others to check it out at least once!
author: Leah A.

description:
So they don't serve hard alcohol which was a bit disappointing. They had plenty of beer options and unique ones at that! We got a mango beer which was pretty tasty! 

Parking wasn't too bad and we found some pretty quick! The place itself had a good amount of seats considering they had a lot more games then some of its competitors in the area. 

This personally wouldn't be my first choice for the "barcades" in the area but is definitely a gret spot to check out!
author: Chantal Noelle T.

description: Came here for my birthday and it was a blast. Only beer and wine, but that was perfectly fine for me. Loved that they had change machines and lots of retro fighting games (Street Fighter, Marvel vs Capcom, etc.). Bathroom lines were reasonable and there's a free water bar. Good selection of pinball machines and other games as well. Reminded me a lot of Ground Kontrol in Portland. Absolutely loved this!
author: Evonne L.

description:
I've heard that this place can get pretty crowded but on a Sunday night at around 9pm you have free reign of the place! It's not a huge place but they probably have 20+ machines of all sorts of arcade games (classic, sports, driving, fighting, pinball, etc.). I believe you can also ask them for a console to play Mario Kart on. I'm not sure how that works as we didn't do so on this occasion. I could see how on a busier night you'd have to wait if you don't feel like playing with strangers. There also isn't much seating so if you're hoping to leave your stuff at a table and play, that might be harder to do.  

It's a really cool ambiance with the lighting, decor and the sounds from the machines. It'd be a great place for a date. 

The only thing is that some of the machines are a bit older and not completely functional. You may have some quarters eaten here or there, notice some calibration errors on the pinball machines or find that a few buttons on the machines don't work. Overall it's not a huge deal, just wish there was a little more attention paid to this (maybe a warning label for the controls that aren't working).
author: Emily L.

description:
Such a cool spot. From a date to hanging out with friends. I came here for the first time this passed Saturday with one of my friends and I had a blast. I love that they have some of my favorite childhood games. Puzzle Fighter!!!! I can play that for hours. Wish they have mario kart, that would totally be awesome. .50 cent per game. They have this game call KILLER QUEEN, 5 players per screen/team and compete with 5 others. I think that was pretty awesome. 

They also have board games. They ask for your ID to keep whiling you hold on to the board games. The beer was slightly overpriced. 2 beer for $15 x 3 that night. But staff was friendly and TONY was awesome, very helpful.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Brewcade is a fun place on the edge of the Castro to chill out and meet people. It's something of a geek's paradise, whether the geekery is for video games or beer.

The staff is friendly and helpful, and the prices are about what you would expect for a mid-Market joint.
author: Philip J.

description:
I love the right idea of having both the bar and the arcade in one place.  That way, it'll be better to play the arcade games if I barely communicate with any strangers whenever I sit between them.  I was about to have a drink first before I walked towards the arcade behind me.  I asked the bartender if there is at least one non-alcoholic Spritzer.  Then he said there are two choices: bottled sodas or a kombucha.  So I settled for a kombucha and watched the big screen.  Of course, I'll be ready to buy a glass of wine or beer on my second visit.  Anyway, I had to finish up my whole glass so I can play the arcade.  No need to pay again for the refill.  I'll do that if I have enough time and money to burn.

Let's see!  Marvel vs Capcom?  Joust?  No coin holes for Whac-A-Mole, but I did indeed scored 160 points back in Museé Mecanique.  Superb, non?  Perhaps I'll go for Killer Queen.  I chose the blue side of the two large arcade machine.  I wasn't here to score to win.  I was testing the controls after putting four quarters.  That's how the game works.  Well, I'm glad I had this much fun on my first visit. :D
author: Jimmy C.

description:
The perfect bar for the inner man-child in you. Brewcade combines nostalgic video games with a good selection of craft brews. 

Like any arcade, your money can go fast here as you move form machine to machine... even faster than your bar tab. Still it's lots of fun to see old faves like Street Fighter and bubble puzzle here as well as reliable pin ball machines. For me though, I'm more impressed with the selection of beers on tap. I tried a couple of brews that were new to me including the cheekily named New Kids on the Hop and the Ascender IPA. The bartender was friendly and answered the questions we had about the brews. There's also a decent amount of seating if you're not wondering around the arcade games. 

It's a fun atmosphere. Good beers and the lively ring of arcade games around you make Brewcade a fun spot to start a night of drinks in the Castro.
author: Jon L.

description:
Great bar arcade .... where adults can play games like kids haha ... TONS OF BOARD GAMES what I call the rentals (give them your ID) just don't forget it.  

First time visitor and will becoming back. Good choices on beer and cans. Decent location (although I'm new to the city) 
Pretty decent size building odd layout they cramp the bar a little but people manage to move around. 
Few of the arcade games didn't work and there wasn't a sign to keep you from putting your money in.
author: Angelina R.

description:
Brewcade is my go-to stop for good quality craft beer and incredibly friendly service. Brewcade's beer list is extensive and even includes a few wine cocktails that are quite good! Try the frozen Grape Drank with the strawberry wine added! Really hits the spot. The beer list is constantly changing and the beer buyer does a good job of keeping things exciting and new. Their bartenders are knowledgeable and have never led me astray with their suggestions. 

There are a ton of arcade games and some pinball machines to play. They are well maintained and on a semi-regular rotation. Recently Brewcade got a competition grade Big Buck Hunter HD machine, which is a blast to play.

Unrelated to the beer or games but something I appreciate is that there's usually a really diverse clientele at Brewcade, something that's not always the case at bars in SF.

All in all an excellent bar that is worth putting into your regular rotation!
author: Mikhail B.

description:
The owners need to address the lack of hospitality and tact with the male bartender working yesterday afternoon.  The female bar tender, while not friendly or inviting, at least got our drink order together.  The male bartender appeared about 40-50 minutes later - I was sitting at a table repacking my backpack when he took my water bottle off the table.  When I told him it wasn't trash he brought it back over and stated to get rid of it because outside beverages aren't allowed and walked off.  Note - this was the first and only interaction with this guy.  Regardless, there is a way to interact with people and treat them with respect.  Especially guests in your city.

Secondly, there were many games, however, close to half of them had notes describing how to get around the menus.  Several of the game consoles appeared to be unauthorized knock off's.  The pinball selection was pretty good however I paid $2 for 3 plays on one of the machines, as advertised, but it only gave me two games.

After the manager contacted me and assured me he addressed the issue, I change the star rating from 1 to 3.
author: Paul S.

description: Awesome drinks! The bartender was super helpful when me and my friends were picking our drinks. Her recommendations for the sours we're dope  and the classic games are dope too
author: Devon J.

description: This was such a fun bar! They have water taps for you to serve yourself to stay hydrated in between brews, which I find genius. The magnetic letters on the wall were a great touch.
author: Samantha B.

description: This is probably my favourite arcade bar for the ones I've been to in SF. It's a casual, divey-feeling bar with good drinks - I particularly like the peach grape drank which is frozen white wine with peach syrup. They don't serve food, but I've seen people come in with outside food on occasion, with no issues. There are lots of arcade games to play (lots of classics!), though the one I probably spend the most time on is Killer Queen, a 5v5 game in the corner of the bar near the entrance. It's definitely a game that attracts people to Brewcade since there are twice weekly league nights (one for serious players, and another one that's a casual meetup). The only thing they're missing is my favourite game, which is Time Crisis, but fingers crossed that it'll just show up one day - you never know :)
author: Bianca C.

description: If you are looking for a fun time, I'd say come to Brewcade to kill a few hours or to spend the night playing games. They have a large bar along the side but if that is not your scene, there are old-school and new-school arcade games throughout the space. They also have a number of themed nights that allow you to easily meet up friends for a fun time or kill a number of hours prior to another event. (aka a good pre-game spot) With the number of arcade games around the place, I'd have to say that the most appealing and more popular is the Killer Queen arcade game. They even have leagues for the game which allow you to bring your own team or meet people there to build a team. Pretty good way to be oober excited to gather berries and kill the queen. I came on a Thursday evening so it wasn't as poppin' as I would expect this place to be on other nights but I can expect this place to be extremely crowded on weekends.
author: Kevin L.

description: This place has a great location and awesome beer selection. We live a few doors down and have stopped in to grab a cold one a couple of times. Would have rated a bit higher but I'm not a big gamer in general.
author: Wade W.

description:
I've only ever come here after work on a Thursday or Friday, so this review is for being there are those times. 

Here's the breakdown of how Brewcade earned its stars:
+1 star for having KILLER QUEEN. Addicted.
+1 star for having Buck Hunter. I like big bucks and I cannot lie.
+1 star for the bartender that helped switch the TVs to the Warriors game when we requested. Thank you! 
+1 star for the large selection of beers, and yes, you can get some of them by the pitcher FYI.

If you're not occupied with playing games though, I can see how this might not be the best of places to hang out at. Music is loud and hard to talk over, and the lighting can get a bit much. It's not always my thing, but once in a while... All in all though, fun spot. One of those places you might start your night at. Find me at killer queen or buck hunter hehe
author: Ashley S.

description:
So glad I found this little gem of a bar in SF! I've never been to a bar/ arcade (or barcade...lol) and this was a cute little place for that introduction!

They've got a wii for up to 4 players (for those modern gamers), tons of older arcade games with favorites such as Pac-man, Galaga, Street Fighter, Super Mario, etc. along with themed pinball machines, and even a newer up to 10 player arcade game! Each arcade game is $0.50 per credit and they've got a cash to quarter exchanger! There are high scores for each gaming area at the top of each game so if you think you've got what it takes to be at the top, go for it!

They serve draft beers and cans, as well as wines and cocktails. Pretty good selection for beers and they've even got a little book for more drinks and bar bites! Happy Hour is Mon- Fri from 4-7 pm, with $1 off drinks!

Only con I'd say is there isnt much arm room when playing games so it's tough, but it's a fun experience! Brews, don't lose- try this place out!
author: Mary F.

description: Very nice people.  Bartender is very friendly and the crowd is  nice.  The issue I have is with the quality of the beers.  Love they carry craft but the ones they had were just okay.  Will give em another chance and update this review accordingly.  Selection of games were okay but would be nice if they rotated and had new ones from time to time.
author: avi a.

description: This place is awesome for a date, or groups of friends! They have tons of old-school arcade machines,  new school, pinball machines and Gaming consoles that you can use on the big screen on the wall! And the bartender Joe, is really awesome, has a great attitude! Thanks for an awesome experience!
author: Marty M.

description:
Super fun and engaging idea that doesn't fully pull through because of the limited space. This is one of the few places that has Killer Queen, which is a super fun, multiplayer versus game. It fits 5 people on each machine at a time so it engages a large group of players and also spectators. The pinball machines are in pretty good conditions. They have Demolition Man, Spider Man, Ghostbusters, Adams Family, and Game of Thrones. This is a pretty diverse set of machines in one place. I would come here just for the pinball machines but not at a busy time. Spider Man played pretty slow, which is great for warming up and feeling good about yourself.

The main issue with this place is how crammed it is. Granted, I came on a Saturday night, but the space itself is just small considering the room you would need for this type of establishment. Compared to other barcades I've to, this is definitely one of the tightest. It's hard to fully enjoy yourself when you keep having to get distracted by people trying to get through. The bar area is pretty small and there's basically nowhere to sit. 

Positives:
+ Killer Queen
+ Good variety of pinball machines

Negatives:
- Crammed space
- Hard to find parking
author: Angie N.

description:
This place is awesome. So many childhood memory games here and good selection of beers. The owners are extremely friendly and welcoming.  The place is pretty small but filled with character. It's actually well lit and theres parking across the street. 

There's outdoor seating, plenty of games, and beautiful decor. This is a great place to celebrate a friend's birthday, and I'll definitely take my friends here for their 21st birthday. I highly recommend trying Killer Queen! It's extremely addicting and fun to play with a group of 5 or more. 

Don't go to any typical bar in SF. Go to Brewcade!
author: Sandra N.

description: Cute little spot in SF. It's a pretty small space so I couldn't imagine going with lots of people. There were pinball games, some arcade games, a couple of driving games, and whack a mole. I was super disappointed that the whack a mole only took dollars. Bummer.
author: Arelys V.

description: A great selection of brews and the games are great! Happened upon the place when wandering with a friend and it was a great stop.
author: Faridah G.

description:
arcades and beer! 

Walls are lined up with old school arcades, like the simpsons, street fighter vs capcom, rampage, metal slug, time crisis, and super smash tv-- all great multiplayer games providing an opportunity to bond, yell, and cheer in victory. i grew up playing these games with my brother so i was able to hold my own against my colleagues ;) The games take quarters, but the have a change machine on the wall

Killer Queen is probably the best game to team bond, giving u an opportunity to go 5v5. It plays like Joust, but with some strategy involved. Grab a beer and let loose!

There are flyers on the walls about video game tournaments, like Golden Eye (!!), and movie nights. 

Beer selection is decent. But the combination of alcohol, arcades, and great company is what really seals the deal for Brewcade
author: Eliza T.

description:
Oh Brewcade, I want to like you more. If you would just buy some acoustic tiles and bring a bit more charm to this space, you will be 4.5 stars. You have a great, if overpriced,  beer list.

It's hard to make new retail construction charming, I realize, but I feel like you can do better. Please bring some sound dampening and some other comforts to your space. 

Love, 

A patron.
author: Shanan D.

description:
Pros: Good variety of drinks at a reasonable cost. They have board games, retro and new arcade games and enough searing for those who want to chill. Patrons from all walks of life and are cool. Overall, good vibe and atmosphere. 

Cons: One bartender liked to tease and was somewhat unhelpful, the other was on his game. 

If you go, def use to Super Mario because it's a CLASSIC.
author: Laurisha C.

description:
I don't leave many Yelp reviews, but this is one of my favorite places in SF and deserves a great one. 


Pro tip #1: 
Street fighter machine has 500+ retro games (Hold 1P Start button!). Includes:
Vs. series - up to Marvel Vs Capcom
Lots of fighters (KOF, SF, Darkstalkers, etc) 
Metal Slug(s) - special version has extra ammo/bombs.
Simpsons
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
X-men
Puzzle Fighter
Tetris/other puzzle games
Megaman titles
Super Mario Bros (Pow button one. Near end of list) 
Original Mario (Near end of list)
Bubble Bobble (Near end of list)

Pro tip #2: 
If the machines are broken in any way, let the staff know. They don't play the games since they're working... so they won't know if no one tells them. The bar takes very good care of the machines when they know about the issues. 

Pro tip #3: 
Hands down best game is Killer Queen. No more league tournaments on Wednesdays, but there is a casual meet-up that day starting at 8pm. Everyone is super friendly and encouraging, and they like to teach people how to play. Good night to show up if you want to "git gud" and whoop your friends when you come back.
Join the FB group for more info on KQ mixer/team tournaments, league, and events: 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/KillerQueenSF/

Edit- Pro tip #4: They have a Wii U with wireless controllers for the big screen(s).
author: Brian L.

description:
Killer Queen.  That is all it takes for a 5-star.  Brewcade has one of the eighteen Killer Queen arcade machines in the country.  I had no idea what Killer Queen was when the night started, but noticed a lot of mentions of it in the reviews.  We had hours to kill due to an early morning flight and this place stuck out.  Once we got there I saw the 10-player cabinet and eagerly waited for my chance to play.

Eventually I had my chance to play with some strangers.  It was a blast.  Easy to pickup, but insanely difficult to master.  The team I was on went back and forth with wins until a new group stepped up on the Blue cabinet.  We mercilessly destroyed them game after game, up until this insane master player joined their team.  Once he joined we got killed over and over.  He was hardcore coaching his team and none of us had any idea how to counter.  We won a few of the following games, but it was crazy.  After a bit some people had to leave and master queen ended up playing 3 vs. 1.  It was wild.

I haven't had this much fun playing a game in years.  It was amazing and a great social experience.  The rest of the place seemed pretty awesome as well, plenty of variety in arcade games for you to play.  I don't drink, but they did seem to have a decent lineup of drinks for those that do.  They also actually had a really good lineup of non-alcoholic drinks as well.  

I wish there were more places around Salt Lake that offered things like this.  I would come here multiple times a month if something like it was near SLC.  Come for the Killer Queen.  I am watching Youtube videos of Killer Queen while I write this and am looking forward to the next time I can play!  Brewcade has risen to a must visit in San Francisco for me now.
author: Curtis C.

description:
The ultimate business idea: find what people liked as kids and mix it with unlimited amounts of booze. Thus Brewcade was born. Craft beer + arcade games = what can go wrong?!

Beer selection is truly immense. I tried couple of sours, because heck, this is what cool kids drink these days. And of course barrel aged stout. Delicious!

We obviously had to play Killer Queen. This is arcade gaming at its best. Up to 10 players in two opposing teams. They have competition night every Wednesday, when you can play for free.

What was tad confusing is that some arcades had different games that what was advertised on the machine. For instance, we wanted to play some good auld Street Fighter and we ended up playing Yet-Another-Space-Invaders.
author: Jakub S.

description: Such a fun and relaxing atmosphere! I love that I can go here after work and enjoy a brew with some friends while playing some pretty cool video games. Highly recommended!
author: Jessica P.

description:
Brewcade, one of twelve Killer Queen hives.

The only arcade game that matters is this awesome 10-player game called Killer Queen. If you go to killerqueenarcade.com, you'll see that this game is only available in 12 locations nationwide. The game is a bit confusing at first because it has a good number of moving parts, but anyone who looks competitive will probably be able to explain the game to you pretty quickly. Unspoken etiquette is that if your team is losing too often, other people can tag in. Tournaments are held Wednesday evenings, which, for n00bs like me, are the nights I need to avoid. Until I become the Killer Queen master, that is. In 2050.

Aside from Killer Queen, Brewcade is known for their $10 GRAPE DRANK, which essentially is a wine slush. Though it's sweet, it's quite sour, so I'm not a big fan.

No cover fee but you're carded at the door. Come for Killer Queen, stay for Killer Queen.
author: Adele F.

description:
If you're looking for some low-key fun on any random night, this is it.

And anywhere I can imbibe and play a video game at the same time is all good in my book :)

Sit at the bar, lounge at the table, or just carry your drank around the joint. Open until 1am, and not to mention, Brewcade is just down the street from me!  Life just doesn't get better. Wine pours are standard, and the list of reds isn't too long - just a Pinot and a Malbec.  But hey, either does the job :)  

As far as the games are concerned, the selection is pretty decent for such a small space.  A few pinballs, a car game, some shooting games, and a few classics like Paperboy, Super Mario and Ms Pac Man.  Let me tell you, I can play the car games all day.  So the fact that my victims can sit in the seat next to me and get beat is enough to wake me up in the middle of the night. 

The only reason I can't dish the 5 is because the machines do sometimes suck your quarters without giving you the game.  

Overall, it's a fabulous place for a date - or better yet - bring a group of friends and get down with some ol' school fun :)
author: Angella S.

description:
Got to finally check out brewcade, great arcades and lots of fun drinks for people. Played some Mario Kart on the giant wall and checked out Alien vs. Predator arcade machine.

A guy dressed as RAIDEN showed up to play games, 'ppreciated it.
author: Colin B.

description:
Friendly, no bullshit kind of place. They've got a few large screens, including a giant projector screen behind the bar, that are usually playing sports (I've come in for Warriors games - fun crowd, generally pretty well attended), something goofy like vintage Wrestlemania, or whatever the video game tournament of the night is. 

The games are definitely front and center here - plenty of pinball, retro arcade games, and a couple more competitive, newer games, Big Buck Hunter HD and Killer Queen, both of which see tournament play at Brewcade. They also run some other semi-competitive nights with prizes, stuff like Mario Kart on Wii U, which is free to play if you're having a beer.

Which is the other part of the equation. Solid beer bar, lots of taps (never counted, but 20ish?) and lots of bottles, including standard staples and some oddballs, including some tasty probiotic ciders and sours. No liquor, as mentioned elsewhere, but I've never gotten bored with the tap list. 

I've always found it to be a friendly place that knows what it's doing and does it well.
author: Thom B.

description:
This Place IS GREAT!

10/10 - Beer Selection
10/10 - Games
10/10 - Community/Bartenders

If you want great beer and to play some arcade games in The City, this your best choice.
Try the wine slurpee thing it's awesome and does the trick ;)
author: Matt B.

description: I came back here recently and there was no urine odor.... so I must have had some really bad luck my first time here!  Had a great time playing Buck Hunter and many other awesome games of my youth.  Also very much enjoyed a bright blue house cocktail made from something I would have only drank in high school.  Sweet spot!
author: Tracy B.

description:
This place is awesome as advertised- Brew (ie..BEER) - Cade (ie Arcade games) so it confuses me when other reviews go on about their meh cocktails, lack of space and few arcade games... Need I remind them it's San Francisco- so if you were expecting the # of games of a Dave and Busters and its size, then please go right ahead and take yourself down to Daly City, the local folk will not miss ya, and you can get all the shitty drinks of your dreams. 

     Now for those that actually appreciate the vintage arcade games of their childhood, you will not be disappointed in the selection (which rotates), favs of mine include Street Fighter, Donkey Kong,   Paperboy, and of course the 5 pinball machines they stock. They also just got a badass new Big Buck Hunter that is so addicting. The atmosphere is lively, relaxed,  and especially fun during sports games (which are on the bigscreen), and its great as a meet up for afterwork drinks as its pretty centrally located in the city, and easily accessed on Market Street. 
    Now for the BEER! Here they excel- by always have a rotating selection of new and inventive local craft beers I get a great sense of what are local brewmasters are creating these days. They always have something for the IPA drinkers, usually 4-5 to pick from, and sours that I cant seem to find at other places. If you're curious, and the menu seems overwhelming, chat it up with the bartenders, they have great recommendations, and always ask if you want to taste if you're wavering on your choice. Also they have wine, but get a beer (death and taxes, please!)

They welcome dogs- so rad. 
They let you bring in food, or get it delivered when the drunchies strike- rad again. 

Brewcade is always on my rotation and there isn't any place like it in the city. Just go!
author: Chelsea J.

description: Great idea, needs some work in execution. I want to really like this place but the awkwardly configured space, average mixed drinks and surly to indifferent staff (maybe we caught them on a bad night but not too friendly) will make this a pass for the next year... will check back in after that to see what's new...
author: Kate A.

description:
Why is this place only 3.5 stars? It's a good bar with nice bartenders, good beer selection and GAMES! I love any bar that has something extra to do, really pushes it over that 4 star hump. There's mostly older games, but who doesn't love pinball and pacman? 

Also, you can play Mario Kart for FREE on the TV above the Killer Queen game (you just have to give the bartender your ID to hold while you borrow the controller.) My fiance and I played with a couple of strangers and it was fun.

Had a good saison and great strawberry hibiscus sour and my fiance had a very tart cider he liked a lot. Bathrooms are clean, decor is cool, you can write things on the wall in magnet letters. Seriously, what's not to like here?
author: Christine U.

description: Stumbled upon Brewcade randomly this past Sunday afternoon. Although I had had this place bookmarked/on my radar I didn't realize I was passing by it until my boyfriend noticed the chess board tables outside.  Us both being the chess nerds we are decided to grab a beer and play a game.  Brewcade is small and unassuming, the walls are lined with vintage arcade games all at pretty affordable prices (I believe cheaper than a place like Golden Gate Tap Room).  The beer selection, although unique and excellent was a bit pricey.  Board games are free you just need to leave your ID behind the bar.  In all, a great spot to stop in play some favorite arcade games you forgot how much you loved and, in my case, get your ass kicked in chess.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
My friend and I stumbled upon this place randomly while we were exploring the area, and it was such a nifty little place! 

Although we didn't get to try any of the drinks, we did take a quick look at their selection and saw that they had lots of beers, wine, and food on their menu. We spent most of the time just playing the old arcade games that they had available, which was so awesome! Just think pacman and paperboy and pinball and whack-a-mole and etc. Each of the arcade games were 50 cents each, and you could also play Mario Kart on the big screen for free! 

Honestly, this place is pretty awesome, and the decor is pretty cool. Overall, this is such a fun and chill place to be, whether it's with a group of friends or with a date.
author: Tricia N.

description:
On the expensive side for Happy Hour, but they do have a great beer selection. Happy Hour prices are a dollar off the listed price.

I ordered the "Grape Drank" which is basically a wine slushie. I actually liked it.

Didn't get to play and of the video games but there are plenty towards the back.
author: Angelica C.

description:
When my friend said she was in town with her new bf, I wanted to find a cool spot with drinks and fun stuff to do. The solution? Brewcade. This place is a great option and reminded me of a similar place I went to down in LA.

Drinks: They have a fairly large selection of beers.

Arcade: They have a good amount of classic video games that will get any late 20-early 30 year olds excited (believe me -- the boys did some gaming while us girls caught up). They also have board games available if you want to stay at the tables. 

Atmosphere: It's cool and casual. It can get a little loud and crowded, but it's still fun.

Service: Bartenders are nice and they clean up the tables pretty frequently, so there's not just empty bottles laying around.

Location: Parking can be a bit difficult in the area, but it's conveniently located pretty central.
author: Leana L.

description:
Brewcade is just a few blocks from my house and it's a great spot to catch up with some friends. They have some classic games I grew up with such as Blitz, NBA showtime, and of course PAC Man. Coolest game though is probably Mario Kart on the projector. There's usually a wait but def worth it.  

Their beer menu is probably one of the better ones in the area--it's a bit tough to get craft beer in the Castro! Outside of one instance with a sarcastic bartender, the environment is really friendly and laid back. No one is trying to rage, more so just have some good fun. I played Uno with some friends and had some good beer. Couldn't ask for more. Oh and I think they have food trucks on Thursday! Pretty cool.
author: luis m.

description: Great bar and bartenders, games are cheap and they show awesome 80s movies on background.
author: Frank W.

description: Good selection of beers. Really fun place. We are visiting from Colorado and this place has a great vibe. The bar tender was super friendly, drinks were kinda pricey (compared to Denver) but great selection of local beers. Played a bunch of games, which was awesome. We had a great time. (Plus, it's literally next door to our hotel, Becks Motor Lodge, so super convenient also.) Thumbs up.
author: Ariel R.

description: PUMP UP THE VOLUME!  Please, I want to be in an arcade and hear the sound environment of the arcade.  Having all the games on mute or barely audible is tragic and kills the experience. We didn't come for the radio or ESPN or to have a quiet chat.  Explaining Moonwalker to people who've never heard of it and every audio flourish was lost on them because it was nearly muted was lame "no it's really funny when you put in the quarters and how the kids praise him and when..." god... .  Playing Joust on mute... sigh...  so much less exciting.  Playing Rampage and leveling a building with your 1st time playing friend on 1% volume... grrrr. Pfff...  Pump it up. Make it rumble with all the weird noises an armada of arcade machines can.  Boom is the sound you should FEEL when pulling the trigger and it should be exciting. You should feel that last life slipping off the screen and that game over sound...You should feel like you're in an arcade.   Please take an hour and fix this.  I'll re-write and re-rate at that time.
author: Eric S.

description: In addition to a broad selection of craft beers and alcoholic "mocktails", Brewcade houses a fantastic selection of classic arcades, plus WORKING pinball machines that they actually maintain on the fly. The machines take quarters, so no need to carry home a pocket full of tokens or buy a card. And finally, my favorite detail is the water taps on the wall so you can stay hydrated with either flat or sparkling water without having to bother a bartender or pay for a bottle. The beers are a little pricey, but it is worth it for the venue.
author: Craig M.

description: Went to Brewcade today and had an amazing time! So, Brewcade is near the Castro District and is accessible via Muni. For those that have never been, Brewcade is a healthy mixture of old skool arcade games and a bar. The beer is cold and reasonably priced and the games make you long for days old. Games ranging from Mrs. Pac-Man to WWF Wrestlemania. The space is decent but the lighting could be a little better. Also, the machines (games) take quarters and sometimes it will ear your money. Overall a good place to hang out.
author: Rhett B.

description: Love this place! The bartender was super friendly and the games were fun! They have game tournaments that are for amateurs.
author: Katie P.

description:
I love an arcade game/bar for adults, especially of the arcade games consist of pin ball machine and classic Atari games.  I don't like those "all in one" console game units where you scroll through a menu to select the game you want.  No Bueno!

The beer list was great, I don't need fancy drinks.  Especially if you are there to play games.  All that will make me happy is PBR.

Only thing that I found funny was that the bathrooms were hot!  Like turn up the a/c or something in there.  Especially with all the stinky bathroom smells.  Other than that fun place to go!
author: Nyla K.

description: This bar is a cute concept and reasonably priced. However, it was extremely crowded on Saturday night. We were still able to play some games, but there wasn't much space at all to hang out, drink, and talk - my group of 5 was squished up against the back of a game machine. It's a relatively small space. It's a fun activity for a very small group or a date, but I'd come back on a weeknight.
author: Cynthia S.

description:
Do you like screaming in order to be heard by your friend standing 2 feet away? A thousand points of light flickering constantly on every surface? Blaring dance music (at a venue with no dance floor)? How about having to constantly wriggle through one-human-wide spaces to get to the next game? 

You can experience all this and more at Brewcade--on a TUESDAY evening, too. (I can't imagine how awful it must be on a weekend.) I went here with some friends because Free Gold Watch was closed. It was a mistake. Go to Free Gold Watch... it's BYOB, spacious, and you can actually hear yourself (and your friends) think. Better games there too. Brewcade's interior lighting design was likely masterminded by Tim and Eric, because I felt like my eyes were bleeding within ten minutes. 

The upside is that they have a fount with really good sparkling water that you can pour yourself. I don't know why more places don't have this. Now that I know it's there I might be inclined to walk in, pour myself some seltzer, guzzle it down and then be on my way.
author: Maxine Y.

description:
A belated 2014 review. By now, Brewcade isn't even considered a new bar in the Castro - but I did go one of the first weekends they were open. Brownie points, anyone?

Though I'm not a gamer (unless an obsession with the old school Nintendo version of Tetris counts?), Brewcade is still a fun bar. Not because of the endless amounts of dudes here. Not because of the copious space. Nope, it's the slush wine on tap. Yes, you read this correctly: Slush. Wine. On Tap.

Whomever thought of this concoction is a genius! It's also a way to get ladies in the door without forcing the issue too much. That's not to say there aren't gals out there who love arcade video games, but let's face it, the guy:girl ratio would be even more out of whack if it weren't for this awesome beverage.

I like the unique concept and everyone working here was incredibly nice. You wouldn't even have to bribe me with free quarters to come back.
author: Abby S.

description:
Brewcade is great. Every time I've been there, at both busy times and slow times, I've had a excellent experience. 

The beer selection is top notch. They seem to carry a regular selection, but also always something fun and new to try. They also have these wine slushies that my lady still talks about (that was a fun next day). 

I also really like the arcade aspect of the bar. I'm not really an arcade person, but it's a really fun selection of games (did someone say Big Buck Hunter... HD??? Yes Please!). Bars can get monotonous, but that isn't the case here. You can be social, you can game, you can game and be social. 

Finally, the staff is great. This isn't the kind of spot where you are going to get rude bartenders. They are friendly and keep the drinks flowing. What more could you want? 

Bottom line, give it a shot. I don't think you'll be disappointed.
author: Nat S.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday night to celebrate a friend's birthday. The place is rather small but has a great vibe to it. The decor is very cool and fitting for an arcade. We got there around 9 and found a table easily but it started getting pretty packed around 9:30.

They also have board/card games that you can check out at the bar so we played a few rounds of taboo and a couple arcade games before heading out. 

Great concept but rather small and crowded. Fun place for a casual evening but would not go with a large group.
author: Rachel N.

description:
We finally get a bar arcade in SF!! I'm a huge fan of Ground Kontrol in Portland, and while Brewcade isn't comparable, it's off to a really promising start. There are quite a few classics, including Paperboy, Smash TV, Joust, and Ms. Pac Man, along with what appears to be a MAME emulator with hundreds (thousands?) of games.

The games take quarters, and there's a change machine near the games. It was pretty mellow during the weekday evening that I was there, and I was able to get my games on without feeling crowded or rushed. The arcade area is a bit small, so I can see how it could get crowded during prime time. 

Definitely a cool concept, and I hope they get a lot more games in the future!
author: Allen T.

description:
Fun arcade meets craft beer pub. I like the concept and it works well. It was fun!

Dropped in after a couple of drinks at Hi-Tops across the street. Tried a few games and ended up staying. The beer selection is good, but they don't have liquor or spirits.

Ended up getting hooked on this game in the front, towards the right as you walk in. It's multiplayer where 2 teams of 4 go head to head. Was confusing at first but the stranger who invited us to play taught us and once you get the hang of it, it was so addictive!

I felt like a loser coming here on and leaving at 2am on a Friday night, but maybe this is the new going out?
author: Billy S.

description:
I've been coming here every Monday night for a month now. I have to give this place 5 stars because of the game Killer Queen. It's an incredibly fun 5-5 arcade game and there's a meetup on Monday nights where people just throw coins on the machine and rotate in and out of play. It's a great way to spend a Monday night, have a beer, and meet some people. Additionally, winning at killer queen results in some kind of high akin to morphine. You just drift off to another place and revel in having crushed your opponents.

When not playing killer queen, you'll find me on the pinball or donkey kong games. They also have a selection of board games to be played with friends.

Even if you're not a huge nerd (am I a huge nerd?) you'll appreciate this bar.  +  what's not to like?
author: Andrew C.

description:
Grape. Drink.

I wish they swapped the games a little more often, but that's a pretty minor gripe. If this looks like your kind of place, it probably is.
author: Joseph G.

description:
This place is AWESOME! First of all, their beer selection is always top notch. They consistently rotate a wide variety of styles and flavors from bay area breweries. There is always something for everyone, including wine and wine and beer based cocktails. The bartenders are always friendly and willing to help you out if you are overwhelmed by all of the options. Once you have a beer in hand, the wide selection of vintage and updated arcade style games are there waiting for you. All of the pinball machines are always a solid decision. However, the new and improved Big Buck Hunter HD is the best!! It is definitely one of the most addicting games. If video games aren't totally your style, they also have a ton of board games you can borrow. I played Guess Who for hours and it took me back!! 

One last perk of this bar is the fact that they are totally cool with you bringing food in or having it delivered to you! Overall, it is a super chill place that is always one of my go-to picks for a fun night out. With great drinks, unlimited food options, game options galore, and easy access to muni stops, Brewcade is never a disappointment!
author: Kalin A.

description:
The "adult" version of an arcade- = Brewcade*

The inner child in me jumped with joy at the 30 something plus games that only cost 50 cents to play. (yes, 2 quarters only!)
So as my co-workers and I tried to battle it out over the games, we had also got to choose from a massive selection of beer and wine. 
The "house special" of frozen flavored wine wasn't too bad either.(peach and watermelon- tasted a tad similar- but delicious and refreshing none the less)

**Pure Genius on compounding Brew and Arcade
author: Ada C.

description:
I finally made it to Brewcade!  And the reason is I wanted to have an amazing date night with my hubby and he loves video games and we both love beer!

I didn't tell him we were going. I made it a surprise. You should have seen his face. First it was a little confusion and then that little boy in him appeared. Yay!!! I love this man. 

We got our beer. What a great selection!!  The beertender was so cool too.  She let us preview a couple beers before we made our final decision. And then again and again. They have a lot of beers!  I mentioned I love beer right?  

My hubby began his walkthrough with beer in hand. I followed with the biggest smile on my face as he stopped at each and every game.  He told me stories and shared memories from when he was a little boy and would sneak off to his neighborhood arcade. And how his mom would find him and drag him home. He was once again in his happy place but with a cold Ale versus a cola. The man was damn near in tears. 

We played all the pinball games and Ms.Pacman and the race car game and so many others. What a great collection!

Brewcade is more than a place to have great beer.  It's a reminder. A reminder to have fun, be a kid, go out and play. 

P.S. He may have gotten the high score, but I got the Wife of the Century Award.
author: Jean C.

description: They have Killer Queen, what else needs to be said? They also have a great draft beer selection with some interesting wine slushies at reasonable prices. The place isn't huge so I can imagine it's pretty packed at peak hours, but a nice spot for some daytime drinking and arcade games.
author: Nicolas H.

description:
A hundred million years ago, there were these places called "arcades" that housed the best and brightest video games on the planet.  It's also where you would find yours truly spending more than his fair share of time and rolls of quarters.

Times have changed and now most people experience gaming in the comforts of their own homes.  So much so that I have to ask, why would anyone need to go to an arcade anymore?

And yet there exists these nostalgic and often fraternal (let's face it not a lot of girls played video games back then) musings about those dark secluded spaces that sometimes also served as electronic sanctuaries from the outside world.

Hello Brewcade.

Brewcade is home to an assortment of classic video games and pinball machines that will have your inner gamer jumping for joy as you once again experience the sights, sounds, and feel of a real live arcade (although tweaked to cater to a slightly more mature game junkie who is old enough to purchase alcohol).

After a couple of rounds of Street Fighter II, a smoked porter, some Addams Family pinball, and a purple grape slushie thing, I was good.

Overall, it was a nice revisit to days of dazedly past and one I may want to go to again.
author: Dan B.

description: I've been to brewcade twice and I must say it's a pretty poppin spot on a Friday night. They have a good variety of beers on tap and their "grape drank" or flavored wine slushes are pretty strong. They don't have THAT many arcade games but if you go up to the bar they have a list of board games you can check out if you just leave your ID with them.  The only complaint I have is that the staff isn't very friendly.
author: Linz C.

description: Whenever I come here it is relatively chill and not super packed as it is late at night. The staff here are extremely friendly and they have a whole list of unique beers that you probably haven't heard of. Staff is friendly and there are a lot of games to play (pinball, wii, etc). It's a good place if you wanna go somewhere a bit more slow pace and want to catch up with friends.
author: Galen W.

description: This place is awesome their drink selection is a little limited but they have Killer Queen which is the most fun arcade game I have ever place. Small place but great atmosphere!
author: Matt L.

description:
I go here twice a week to play Killer Queen with one of the best communities I have ever been a part of. On top of that the beer selection is really good and always rotating. The staff is super friendly, The get-to-know-your-name kind of staff. Shawn the bar owner is very nice. He plays games with the patrons and is always listening to their ideas, complaints, compliments. The place is brilliantly decorated. They throw fun parties like Neon Arcade Night with black lights and funky ornaments. We've also held some Killer Queen tournaments.

If you want to meet great people, drink beer, and play video games, you've found the right place.
author: Tony H.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night and the place was packed! By which I mean not just friends chilling but groups turning up and having a blast. 

Super fun idea to mashup an arcade and bar so it's not just a few machines sitting in a corner collecting dust. Great place to end up that I'd classify as a "bar+" (more than a bar, less than a lounge / full arcade). 

Smiled so much at the magnet letters on the wall - proof it's in the little things! Also find it hilarious they serve Kombucha, but heart of Castro what are you gonna do *shrugs*

Only thing I'd change is cut down on those green laser lights pointing every which way. Kinda distracting when you're watching a game on the big screen and while attempting to maintain eye contact during a conversation haha.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Came here when we were in San Fran visiting my best friend and it was super fun! I don't personally drink but my bf and friends said the beers were great. Definitely a cool spot to just hang out and play some old school video games.
author: Melissa M.

description:
I ordered two drinks from here, a Hefeweizen and a Lil Sumptin. Both drinks were $6 each. Total to $12 right? I handed the bartender a $20, and he just walked off and disappeared. Didn't even think to give me my change back. $8 tip for two beers? Heck no. It was the tall black bartender with dreadlocks. So thanks for treating your customers like that.

Otherwise, it's a decent enough spot. Lots of beers on tap. Lots of arcade games. Some of the machines stole quarters but hey what can you expect from a place that combines electronics and alcohol.

If not for the whole bartender thing I'd be back, but I'll pass for now.
author: Sean H.

description:
** No Simpsons. I repeat, no Simpsons. (Yet.) **

Change machine's broke.
Get 25c's from bartenders.
One of the games ate my coins.
So narrow aisles between machines.
But once Simpsons comes,
None of the negatives will matter.

I'm on some high score lists.
(Till actual gamers show up :p)

P.S., Where's Sunset Riders?
Mexican was #southernplayalisticadillac
In the flamingo poncho
With double shotguns, muzzafuzzas.
author: Dan B.

description:
Arcade games, pin ball machines, board games and BEER!!! Everything I love to do on a casual night. I was happy my friends wanted to go here, too, because I've been wanting to go to this place ever since I heard it's a fun place to play games and drink beer. They event have a screen set up above the bar to watch wrestling and/or sports games. 
And if you're not a beer fan, no worries. They also have other drinks, such as Wine Slushies, coffee and other non-alcoholic drinks. My favorite is their nitro-stout beer. I also ended up buying their Habanero chips, which has the perfect amount of spiciness and cool comic book packaging, too.  
I will be back for more fun nights drinking beer, and playing board games and arcade games.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Had a few selections of classic games. Killer queen was my fav :) 

I drank the apple fritter frizz, it had a cinnamon taste.
author: Karen L.

description:
This is the type of bar I been waiting for since I have turned 21. As a gamer you want a place with old school video games like this. And as a beer drinker your want a bar with this kind of selection of beers. 

All old school video games, and pinball machines. Games I fell in love with growing up. The decor is real nice and modern looking as well. And you can have fun with making out words on the wall. Atm as well in case you forgot some cash. 

The beer tenders have all been very kind. And are willing to answer questions about the beer. They do offer some light snacks as well. And have 2 tvs to catch the game. 

Parking does suck in the area. But very close there's a pay to park in case you give up. There's many places to grab a bit all around; sushi, Mexican, etc. Plenty of other nightlife around as well.
author: Gustavo A.

description: Wide selection of games, excellent drinks. They even have a Wii U they'll let you play ssb4 and Mario kart on if you buy a drink! They even mailed me my ID after I forgot it and drove back home, solid establishment, would go back
author: George A.

description:
Hey is that Jeff Bridges over there? ...Nope just me going HAM on the TRON machine!

I know the main draw here are the arcade machines but hot damn, the tap lists here send a craft beer lover into a headspin!
author: Sam J.

description:
I love this place, great mix of people. Great games. They serve Boulanger diet sodas, which are quite good. I wished they had more options maybe the diet cherry version.

https://www.boylanbottling.com/product-category/diet-sodas/
author: Lucky S.

description:
