I'm a little biased because this place fits my four primary needs: it has excellent beers, it's local, some classic arcade games, and - at last! - pinball. 

The drinks selection is great, both alcoholic and not: some fine ales, and some unique and tasty soft drinks. Prices are about average by Castro standards, and you'll want to get some change so you can play the games. 

The cabinets are universally 50 cents a game, accepting quarters only - there's a change machine available. Some older games aren't very good at saying you need to insert multiple coins; I wonder whether this is responsible for some of the complaints of machines swallowing quarters. 

Some of them, however, are likely legitimate. My only real complaint is that some of the machines aren't very well maintained. Some have dodgy joysticks or buttons, and some definitely have eaten a coin on me. 

It's not, therefore, a perfect arcade, but given the choice I'll happily call in anyway. If they can fix the maintenance problems it'll be even closer to that ideal.
author: Sophie M.

description: Huge beer, wine, and NA drinks ... AND old school arcade games!! Perfect combo!  A must-visit joint in SF
author: Dustin T.

description: A friend suggested this video game bar spot to visit on a Thursday night. Dope spot, one of the bartenders had some bangers playing through his playlist. We even played a game of super smash on the big screen! The place is a bit cramped but good to meet up or start the night definitely.
author: Rj L.

description:
Great place to hang out with fun arcade games and decent beer choices
Pro tip: trying getting in before 8 pm for a spot at the games.
author: Alex P.

description:
Fun and energetic place! Pretty crowded on a Saturday night so it was hard to play the games you wanted.

Mostly game machines, pin ball, and then you can rent board games from the bar.

Beer & wine only, frozen wine aka "grape drank" was tasty. Good for small group or a fun date!

(I brought $20 in quarters, spent $15 of it, just so you have a gage)
author: Rachel T.

description:
This is a wonderful, gloriously fun beer bar.

Tbh I'm not a big fan of beer, but the bartender was super good about finding something delicious and then later introducing us to the wine slushies. #problemsolved 

Beer folk will appreciate the beer I'm sure but the part I loved about this place were the games. There's a jackpot of board games lying around that you can bring back to your table, play with and be merry. (Personally recommend uno) 

There's a change machine so you can play the old school arcade games. frogger and some sort of race game around SF were particularly great. 

Also free water all night. A++ for the SUPER nice and cool bartenders.

We'll be backk
author: Andrea D.

description:
Nice selection of beers. Killer queen is a fun and original game they carry. Some fun arcade games but also a bunch that aren't fun or interesting. They also have Mario kart.
Nicely designed
author: Jones T.

description:
SF finally has a barcade! It's pretty simple, beer + arcade games = fun. They have a good selection of reasonably priced beers, tables for chatting, some retro games, a wii u (with mario kart!), and a magnetic board with lots of letter magnets. 

I recommend coming earlier if you want to play good games or find a good seat. I went on a Saturday and it was really crowded, I had to wait outside for 5-10 minutes. The demographic is pretty typical of SF, super diverse: folks from Castro, people on dates, college friends, etc. 

Overall, I think it's a fun concept at a reasonable price. Beers are $7-10 and arcade games are .50 cents a round. They also have still or sparkling water and are efficient with their bathroom systems (sinks on the outsides and non gender discriminatory bathrooms). Although the night I went was a little too crowded, I still enjoyed a beer and watching people play games. I hope the barcade concept catches on and continues to grow!
author: Steven V.

description: This is probably one of my favorite video game bars in the city!!! From Mario Kart and Killer Queen, to the older more classic games like Pac Man and Joust there is something fun for any age group (21+). The bartenders are friendly, passionate, and extremely hard working. Also featured: awesome beers on tap and food just a few short steps awwy!! Shouout to my two favorite bouncers Daniel and Justin!!!
author: Anna Z.

description:
A huge variety of beer options, wine slushes and a ton of retro arcade games, is there anything else you need?

Killer Queen is a fun game for groups, 5v5 is possible =)

Great for groups, just make sure to get a reservation since seating is limited

Overall Thoughts

Solid place to hangout with friends over drinks and video games
author: Eddie W.

description:
Oh man, where do I begin. Let's start off by saying that I love barcades in New York and in Portland. I am a fan of drinking and playing video games. Combining those two things together is basically the best thing anyone has ever thought of. However....

+1 star: I don't drink beer, but they definitely get 1 star for offering like 30 beers on tap. All the taps look really pretty.

+1 star: There's a cute chalkboard with magnet letters on it so you can write cute things and then take pictures of things you wrote that you thought were clever when you were drinking 30 kinds of beer, but then when you looked at the pictures later, realized were  maybe less awesome than you had originally thought.

-1 star: At least two of the games we tried to play took our quarters and didn't react to the fact that we just given them silver coins in exchange for something.

-1 star: The game console that said joust did NOT have joust. Sooooo disappointing as this is one of my favorite games of all time.

-1 star: The bathroom situation seems quite unfair. The boys get their own bathroom, but the 2nd bathroom is co-ed. What year is this?

I guess I'll just save my barcade visits for when I'm out of town.
author: Robin M.

description:
Alright place to spend an hour or so. Good luck finding a place to seat. Way too much people at one time that you can't even walk without having to ask someone to move.

Cool games bring back nice memories from childhood.
author: Gilbert A.

description: Love this place.  Brought our office here for happy hour and it was a hit!
author: Sarah M.

description: Came here on a Friday night and it was packed. Not necessarily a good thing.. It was hard to move anywhere and sometimes people just block the walkways. I heard the drinks here aren't great when I got here so I didn't get anything from the bar. However, they do have free self serve still and sparkling water in the back corner which is definitely a plus. The arcade games are old and outdated for the most part and not the most fun. Music here can be turned up a little louder. Not the best but also not the worst experience.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
An arcade-cum-bar with wine slushies designed for adults? Count me in.

Wine slushies sound 1) gross, 2) like the recipe for a hangover. Only the latter is true. These are freaking delicious. I typically hate pre-mixed drinks, but these are tart, not too sweet and truly addictive. Love love love. 

There's a great variety of arcade games, from the nostalgic (Street Fighters! Pac-Man! Area 51!) to the new and modern (...can't remember the names of these, but they were also fun - especially the one designed for groups, which is awesome if you're with a lot of friends).

My only real complaint is that some of the older machines are broken, and just eat your quarters. But that only makes the whole experience more authentic and reminiscent of your childhood, amirite?

All in all, a great addition to SF.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Came here for an after work event. 

Pros
+Mario kart and super smash brothers on the big screen
+Wide selection of beers and old school arcade games
+Clean bathrooms
+killer queen!!!

Cons 
+Nothing bad. Unless you are an old school arcade gamer, this was okay. You can be done here after an hour or so.
author: Linda N.

description:
This place is a ton of fun! 
We went  in a Tuesday night so it wasn't too crowded & there was only one game that we wanted to play that was always taken- Super Mario bros, go figure :)
There are probably about 20-25 different arcade games.
Several times we had issues that the machines eat our coins- we didn't care too much bc we would only loss  a few quarters but i figured I should tell someone so it didn't happen to anyone else & I was told that they have a "no questions asked" policy & they refund you completely. He also got on the phone right away with someone & was explaining which machine & what was happening to get it fixed! Talk about great customer service!
Lots of beer on tap & their famous wine slushie!
They had a self serve water area with atill & sparkling on tap! LOVE IT!
The place was clean & a great environment with fun jams playing in the background. Will post pics of some of the games they had.
author: Ashley G.

description: I've been to Brewcade twice now and it's a really fun place! There's a ton of beer with cool names! Not to mention dozens of old school arcade games. It's a good place for groups but it always seems to be crowded so get there early and grab a spot! Also! Happy hour is M-F 4-7! ;)
author: Meliza M.

description:
(Pac Man theme song plays in head).

It's exactly what you think it would be. Come in with some quarters, play some old-school video games. Grab a pint. Get on with your day.

I wonder what they'll do to keep this place fresh, as months pass, though?
author: Sean B.

description:
Much as in The Fountain or The Time Traveler's Wife, I find myself looking back temporally at a previous existence. But where there might've been one of two beautiful Rachels, I am met instead by Paper Boy and Donkey Kong, Jr.

I am both 9 and 32, and there is a Neo Geo console offering Final Fight. In only one of these realities am I actually playing the game, brawling through Metro City with an amazing glass of red, while my friend who invited me to this media opening is engaged in her own battle against ghosts, fruit, and those little dots that Pac-Man can't seem to get enough of.

Then there are Millipede, Willow, Galaga, and many other remnants of our beloved lower-bit past. Paired with the promise of a nice selection of craft beer, wine, and cocktails, how could anyone not love this bar?

Brewcade is a welcome addition to the hood, located a short walk from Church Street Station and just next door to Hecho. I highly recommend checking it out (when it officially opens on 12/10/14).
author: Keane L.

description: The concept is cool but in reality it was a letdown. The games were fun, obviously, but the bouncer kept telling people to quiet down. Also, they kicked people out more than 30 minutes before it closed. Last call is one thing, but telling people to leave is another. Also, it was raining, and they didn't let us wait for ubers/taxis outside the bar under the awning. I was there with two friends and there was another group of about 5-6 people and no one was super loud or anything. It was just weird and the whole time it felt like they didn't want people inside. The place is super isolated too, so it was annoying since we made an effort to go all the way there because an arcade/bar sounds like the coolest thing ever. Anyways, it's not horrible, but I didn't have a great time and I wouldn't really recommend it to anyone
author: Megha M.

description:
Frozen wine on tap was not very good. I kinda thought it was going to be something tasty like a pina colada, but it really was just wine mixed in slurpee-like ice that didn't taste so great (watered-down wine) once it started melting. The caramel popcorn from CC's that they sell there is amazing though. But of course, the drinks and food there feel somewhat overpriced. I guess it wouldn't be hipster enough for the Mission if it wasn't horribly overpriced.

As for the place itself, it gets CROWDED. Even early around 3pm on a Saturday afternoon. The layout as others have complained is quite horrible. Literally packed back-to-back and unless you plan to go there to play games and drink by yourself, this isn't a place that's really cut out to handle a group of larger than 2. I'm a small person and don't mind small spaces as much as some other places, but I definitely agree the layout and how closely the machines are put side by side is just a little ridiculous.

Oh, also, they charge a fee if you accidentally leave your credit card there overnight and don't close out the tab. It's something like 15-20% of your bill.
author: Joanne Y.

description:
I want to put the disclaimer out there that I will probably update my review in a few months once Brewcade gets its game together... no pun intended. I love the concept of this place, and it just opened.

There are more arcade machines than I thought, but I don't like how cramped that area is. I just feel so claustrophobic... and I'm not even claustrophobic. There is plenty of seating to hang out with your friends, but the section in front of Brewcade seems out of place. There's something about the atmosphere. It just feels... not cool and homey quite yet. Maybe it's because everyone is still getting used to a new bar. It's hard to tell how much some of the games cost because the prices have been rubbed off from the machines being so old. I think it's 25 to 50 cents, so if one quarter doesn't work... put in another one.

They have a wide selection of craft beers, which is cool. It would be even better if there was some sort of beer menu (maybe they're working on it) or if their taps were labeled. There's a refrigerator on the side of the bar for non-alcoholic drinks. Super random. Everything just seems super spread out. The beer is in one section of the bar and the games are in another. Brewcade definitely has some work to do, but I think they're off to a decent start. I would recommend checking it out now just to compare to what it will become in a few months!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
The machines cost $0.50 each, even the oldest games. Multiple of the machines don't work and just eat your quarters. The controls on many of the machines are frustratingly imprecise. Multiple machines are out of order. 

Brewcade has lots of beers on tap to try. It's a good place if you're into beer. 

It's a very unsatisfactory experience, however, if you're into classic arcade games. If you're into classic arcade games, go to High Scores Arcade in Alameda instead. They have the best classic arcade cabinets, keep their machines in top condition, and offer unlimited play for one low price.
author: Chris B.

description:
No way albertino! Here comes the judgment train! Choo... choo...

I love this place it's like my own little slice of Brooklyn in the mistro!  We got some free willy on blast, bike messengers chillin they caps, also I saw pharell here on opening night, they gots some mean ass beertenders.

It was like communist times.
author: Andy G.

description:
Ninja Turtles, Simpsons, and Xmen are missing.  Maybe we can get some pinball machines.  This place is seriously lacking compared to other barcades.

TINY glass of beer for $7.  

It's really overpriced here and worth checking out once.
author: Chris L.

description: Great environment! Staff and owner are very friendly. We came to play Killer Queen after getting hooked on the game in Portland. The machine was having trouble with an update so we waited a little, but the proprietor gave us a free pitcher of beer when he saw we were waiting to play! Great guy!The KQ crowd was very tight knit yet were very positive towards us newer players. They even had a Super Smash tournament going. This place is awesome!
author: Robert J.

description: The wine slushie "Grape Drank" is a cool idea and tastes good, but pretty small. The ambience is really chill and it has a lot of classic arcade games.
author: Abraham G.

description:
Weak.  Is there a way to get negative stars on Yelp?

This place is more of a lounge than the "Brewcade" as they call it.  They have more lounge seating than they do arcades.  If they get more arcades I think it could call itself a Brewcade....  Certainly as of right now, doesn't compare to the ones in Chicago/Portland/Denver/New York. 

Step your game up, get some more arcade games from the 90's. X-Men, Ninja Turtles, Street Fighter 2, Simpsons just to name a few.

On top of that the drinks are super expensive AND the arcades are a shit ton of money, how the f*ck is a game going to cost 75 cents to play..... GTFOH, but I get it, its SF rent is high, but get some more variety in there... half the people there weren't even playing any games.

That is all.

womp womp
author: Cliff S.

description: Cool spot, great selection of craft beer on tap, old school arcades from the 80's 90's . On top of that the service is great.
author: Mario S.

description: Love Brewcade  perfect for dates or just with a group of friends! All the hipster beers and drinks are really fun to try if you're into that. Obviously it's not a cheap night out but it's SF so it is what it is
author: Shivam P.

description:
Fun idea for a bar and awesome that they had all of my childhood favorites.  Was I the only the 80's kid who loved playing Paperboy?  

Two complaints:  no hard liquor available (but still a good selection of craft beers and ciders), and the layout is a little odd:  bare-bones decor, with games situated really close together.  If the place gets busy, I could see the latter becoming an issue.  There is something about the lack of ambiance that makes me somewhat uninterested in visiting again.
author: Joanne G.

description: Randomly/spontaneously decided to check this place out when we drove past it. Pretty cool, small place. Most games are at least $0.50. Beer only bar, but I just found out through Yelp that this place has wine slushy?! WHAAAT!! I need to come back for that. Maybe if I drank one, two, or ten of those, I would've had more fun haha... but the popular games were usually occupied. I wish there were more arcade games that I knew.
author: Annie S.

description: Great selection of games. I will say that the cramped floor plan didn't bother me because I was too focused on the game I was playing at the time, but the pinball machines are close to the front doors, so you end up kind of freezing over there during the winter months.
author: Bianca H.

description:
Bar is FILLED with arcade games and offers wine slushies. What more do you need to know-- visit this place! 

Its super rad.
author: Denniz S.

description:
Great game selection, DC comics animation on the big screen, but the drink options are pretty weak.

Get a full bar, please.
author: Miles L.

description: Highly recommend you get the peach flavored wine slushy! And bring quarters to play the games. Great atmosphere.
author: Emily L.

description: Best place ever! Tony was the BEST attendant ever. Super knowledgeable about the games. He showed us secret menus where we could find hundreds of games including my old school favs like Phoenix, Centipede, and Galaga. I will definitely be coming back to this neighborhood gem, mainly because Tony made it fun and we stayed because of the sub-menus.
author: Heather D.

description:
Dive like, decent beer, fun arcade idea, was not crowded and overall good bar crawl stop. Will be returning.  

*they did not have arcade game Rampage
author: Daniel D.

description: Arcade games and beer. What more could you want? Ok, well, a few (vegan) food items would be nice but we can't get everything. Came here recently and had a few beers and corn nuts while the bartender had the best shoegaze mix on the stereo. Almost afraid to go back, as I don't think the experience could be that good again. But with the variety of beers they have on tap, you know I will be.
author: Jon T.

description:
I'm a huge fan of classic arcade games but I didn't feel that enough classics were present. Just as everyone else has said, the games are crammed into one section of the bar. With people playing shooting games, it's hard to get by and get to others. Oddly enough it was busier at 3pm than at 7pm on a Saturday. By the later time, everyone was focused on drinking beer. When I'm doing that in the area, I will pick Lucky 13 over Brewcade any day. 

The beer selection was vast though. That was nice but trying to see what was on tap was annoying. The only list is on paper. 

If I'm in the area and want to kick ass on Milkipede, I will stop in but I wouldn't make it my destination again. Shame. I really wanted this to work!
author: Tera K.

description:
Okay, so after blasting Brewcade in its early days, I'm happy to report they've turned the place around, and it's now a damn good spot to have a beer and play games.

The improvements:  they've re-designed the layout of the place so that the games are spaced out much more, and now you can hang out and play (before it was either/or).  They've also added pinball machines (!!) which are in great working order (shout-out to the Gamemaster who takes care of the machines -- he's a great guy and doing a fine job).  In short, everything about the games at Brewcade now basically kicks ASS, from the selection (Robotron with two joysticks! Tron!! Donkey Kong!! Adams Family Pinball!!) to the price.  Thumbs up there.

But there's one continued problem, and it's a big one.  The beer selection sucks ass.  I mean,  you can't even offer ONE normal beer, Brewcade?  Not ONE?  You've got Uncle Cooter's Sow-Ear Triple Bock, and 666 Brewery's Satanic Saliva IPA, but not one goddamn Corona?  Not one Heineken?  Not one beer I can get at the grocery store?  Really? 

I mean, come on.  A game of Robotron lasts 45 seconds and takes two weeks off your life.  I don't want to drink some extra-fermented rat urine from upper Bavaria, I want a PITCHER OF MODELO that I can pound to regain my nerve.  Or really ANY regular beer that I can drink quickly. I get it:  you're not the bowling alley, you're not serving nachos and pabst.  But do you have to be sooo high-falutin that you can't cater to plebes like me who just want a normal friggen beer??? You can charge me your higher prices, I don't care, I just want a regular beer!

Let me put it to you like this:  I'm a drunk.  I drink all the damn time.  But I was there Saturday afternoon and I didn't drink AT ALL, because I'm not down with all that craft beer nastiness!  Just feature one regular beer for chrissakes, PLEASE.  I had a really critical review on Yelp and I came back and changed it because you guys have improved so greatly.  Can't you repay a brother by offering even one regular beer??
author: Cody V.

description:
Came here with some friends on Saturday night. 

It wasn't super busy, but it was only 7:30.

The décor is really barren,  and it makes the place feel cold and not vey welcoming.

It seemed the games were squeezed super close together, which wasn't necessary as there was a lot of extra space between tables and walls.

I liked my beer, but no one in our group would return.
author: Amanda G.

description:
New space, new business, and a new concept for the Castro. Bar and pac-man.

Everything old is new again, at some point, and for the vintage and slightly beat up arcade machines that time is now.

Draws a young crowd, most have never seen machines like the ones here. 

Interesting beers, quite a selection. If you don't know beer, this might be a good place to learn as the staff is friendly and informative, and it does get busy.

Enjoy!
author: William M.

description: I frequent Brewcade since it is a few blocks from my house and I'm very passionate about beer. Aside from having a great beer selection, Brewcade also has a great bartender! Miller is always happy and welcoming whenever I come in! She's very knowledgeable with her beers and is always willing to let me sample them before acting deciding which one I want. She's fantastic! I highly recommend you come in when Miller is working, she won't let you down!
author: Sabrina H.

description: Great beer selection and a bunch of arcade classics and pinball machines. The highlight is the 10 (5 on 5) player Killer Queen game. My only wish is there were more modern games, as almost everything was from the late 90s or earlier besides Tekken 5 and Killer Queen
author: Michael S.

description: Good selection of beer and a fun place. Didn't have some of the game I would have liked, but still a good place to go grab a drink and play games.
author: Ryan J.

description:
This place is a gem! They serve a giant list of craft beers, a handful of wine options and even some type of frozen wine drink! I haven't had any of the wine because the beer list is fantastic. So I can't help out any beer haters.

There is a machine where you can obtain quarters from. All of the machines work with quarters- so perhaps you could skip doing laundry for a week or two? They play music over their system like a normal bar. So if you're a "gamer" and are in it for the cool sound effects- this isn't a place for you. It's like a typical arcade in that there are old and new arcade games. Unlike a typical arcade- you cannot hear all of the dings, shots, bells, whistles etc from every single game. I actually prefer listening to some great songs and just playing the games. 

Dogs are not allowed inside for obvious reasons. But I believe if/when they have their tables outside you can bring Fido. 

OMG the best part: Each machine has a beer holder! If it's a two player game- there are two places for your beers :)
author: Karen A.

description:
This bar has a variety of options (beer and wine only though!) and some solid entertainment! :) I enjoyed the large selection of beers. It was actually a bit overwhelming for me since I'm still new to enjoying beers and figuring out which I like, but I would much rather have too many options than too few! It's great for those who aren't sure which beer they will like or want to try something new; the bartenders are helpful and willing to describe the various options, give suggestions, and more importantly let you sample a few to be sure you find one you like before making your final choice. The one I decided on (which I can't remember the name of ) was described on the large wall-side menu as a hazelnut beer. It was true to the description and delicious! The other drink I had was the frozen wine one. It tasted just like frozen champagne. It was pretty good but I was expecting something a little fruitier. To be fair, I ordered it by referring to it as "the frozen drink" and hadn't realized it was wine afterwards. Still pretty tasty. I also enjoyed the arcade games that line the bar. They have games ranging from Rush (yessss!) to Pacman to Pinball.
I enjoyed it overall, 4 stars for only having beer and wine, but I would be happy to go back again!
author: Shav S.

description: The drinks were good but the games were trash. Their website advertised a whole bunch of other games that they didn't have. Also most of them had shit controls. I can't play Tekken 5 with a stick that doesn't go forward.
author: Shawn M.

description: Awesome spot!! Arcade games galore and great brews. So many to choose from. But... if you're going to be a Brew Bar then your mugs better be cold. So minus 2 stars for that. I like my IPAs cold and fresh.
author: Maria G.

description:
Brewcade definitely puts their own stamp on the standard arcade. They cater to a specific demo, but fortunately for them, that demo makes up a large portion of San Francisco's population. Our company threw a party here last week and everyone had a great time. 

The craft beer selection is awesome (I stuck to the Summer Porter and Oyster Stout but there were many options for IPA lovers) and they even have a water station, complete with still and sparkling taps. A few people in our party opted for wine and ended up drinking out of water cups since there were no wine glasses. Not what I would call classy, but hey, it's an arcade. 

Bring lots of quarters! Most games are 50 cents (2 player = $1) with a few exceptions. They have a great variety so there's really something for everyone. To name a few: Buck Hunter, Tekken, Street Fighter II, Marvel vs. Capcom, Pacman, Mrs. Pacman, 1942 (!!!!), Frogger, 2 racing games, 3 or 4 pinball machines (including Addams family!) and just as many other games that I can't name.
author: Shaina V.

description:
Went for the first time on Super Bowl Sunday and it was great! Fantastic beer selection as well as good n/a sodas (for non-drinkers). My friend got their wine slushy, which she swears by. It's a small space but that makes it cozy! A great selection of old arcade games, although Joust wasn't working which was a bummer. They don't serve food but you can order delivery to the bar; just think ahead and either bring or ask the delivery service for flatware...we were eating sausages with our hands.

I'm trying to think of anything I didn't like but I can't! It's close to the Muni Church St so easy to get to. I'm definitely going to be a frequent visitor when I'm in the city.
author: Victoria G.

description:
One of my favorite spots in the City. Fun, lively, excellent selection of beers, great music (especially when Ao is sharing his playlist), and amazing and knowledgeable staff keeping the beer flowing.

The game selection is great (arcade and board games), there is a full magnet wall with refrigerator magnets, and movies/documentaries play in the background, making you realize that the the fact you couldn't wait to grow up has been validated. Finally. Adulthood is here and it's awesome.
author: Janiene L.

description:
I'm so glad the initial hype of Brewcade finally wore off because now I can actually go and play arcades without it being crowded with swarms of people who are like "omg I love Mario brothers!!!" and you're just like, "Man, I'd love to play some Marvel vs. Capcom without people just obnoxiously crowding some place they have no interest in being."

I love all the different beers, ciders, ales, etc they have on tap. There's something for everyone. Also, bonus points for having still water and sparkling water on the tap for self service; I love that idea!

The men's bathroom is a bit weird. If you're using a urinal and someone opens the door you're probably going to get smacked while giving everyone outside a free show.

"There are too many games squeezed tightly together": have people ever been to an arcade before? 

"The machine ate my quarter": you over privileged child, that's what happens at arcades. It's a quarter, deal with it.
author: Tommy C.

description:
Had a great time reliving some of my childhood experiences while chilling on cold glasses of beer on tap. 

Modern with an old school twist, I enjoyed my time here playing Marvel vs. Capcom and making it to the boss! The arcade machines are the same ones since 10+ years ago, and they take quarters. (Yes, quarters, not tokens!) There is a handy change machine if you need to fill your pockets with change.

C'mon! Neo Geo?!

Good times!
author: Jamie Y.

description:
Cool concept unfortunately it didn't live up to it.
-Most games are like rejected, wtf never heard of. Not a great selections of arcade games. Maybe like 3-5 one we actually heard of. 
-Super tight/crowded, all the games are packed into a tiny space, it's hard to play games and drink. I rather go to DnBs. 
-Wtf, were in SF and there's a Huge Seahawks neon light hanging on the wall. Know what city your in?! 

No need to come here again.
author: Julie B.

description: Great concept. Games are very worn down. Some of the joysticks are not very good.. would have been funner drunk? Neo Geo did eat my quarters on both sides,  but didn't want to bother the bartender.
author: Rob L.

description:
Fun place with good drinks and beer selection - they even had a decent non-alcoholic beer, which made me really happy. None of the games stole my coins or anything.

Highly recommended - the Michael Jackson game. Make sure you use the hat twirling superpower as often as possible.
author: JF H.

description:
I really like the resurgence of arcade games coming back into fashion in the bar format. It's like Wunderland grew up right along with us.

We popped into Brewcade to kill a couple of hours with a couple of beers and a couple of rounds of pinball. Pretty much everything in Brewcade is 50 cents a play, which isn't outrageous, but I would have much rather everything been a quarter. That's how Wunderland would have done it. From a nickle to a quarter, that seems like fair inflation when wages have been so stagnant.

The beer selection is great. They had grapefruit Sculpin on tap and being from San Diego, I always like to see Ballast Point doing well in other markets. They have two different "cocktails" that are made from various beers and wine. I went with the Grape Drank which is a wine slurpee. Honestly, I couldn't get through it. Everything was just too acidic for my taste, but other's mileage may vary.

The old school game selection was good. Staples like Pac Man and arcade Super Mario were represented. Kiss Pinball was there (at a dollar a play though), as was Demolition Man, one of the most complicated mechanical hybrid pinball machines produced. There were also some newer games like Tekken 5 as well. One of my favorites, Marvel versus Capcom is here as well, though the screen is a bit wonky. I think you may have a migraine if you play that one too long.

All in all, a lot of fun to be had here and an easy place to kill a couple hours. Just make sure you bring small enough bills for the change machine or you may be leaving with some pretty hefty pockets. Either that, or buy your beer in quarters.
author: James G.

description: This establishment is a great place to hang out and have some drinks and play some pinball and old school arcade games. The bathrooms were clean i loved that the faucet was outside the bathroom. There was no line for the bathroom and i was shocked. Great idea for a bar setting and the place was clean as well. The bartender Alex Miller was the best ever.  She Was helpful in making my drinks not so strong and i seemed to catch a nice buzz while playing pinball. Thank you Alex for making our eve great . We will be back next time we come to sf
author: Kelli H.

description:
VAST improvement as time has gone on. Congrats to the ownership for revamping the layout, making it feel much more open, and really bringing the place to the next-level. 

PROS:
Good game selection
Great beer list. Was really impressed with the selection and all the local options

WISH LIST:
Serve food please, somehow. Maybe food trucks outside or something I can munch on. I know it's hard with all the games but I love food.
author: Alex L.

description: Killer beer list, pinball, and arcade machines! What else could you ask for. Definitely one of my favorite bars in the Bay Area.
author: Lars S.

description:
Killer Queen !!
I loveeeeeeeeeeee this place for having killer queen game machine !! 
This game is awsome ! we played for like HOURS lol
only need $1 to play 10 players
I will def go back for more killer queen lol
author: Yumi K.

description: Brewcade is a cute, new, trendy bar. They serve sour beer which is legit. I'm an IPA person, but am kind of addicted to their sour beer.  The bartenders are nice and the vibe is chill. They also have tons of arcade games to play! The only thing I don't like is their layout. They have a large open space which is nice, but needs to be rearranged. It is just a weird set up. Still a great spot if your in the area.
author: Natalia H.

description:
Alcohol and Arcade Games...there are hardly any better combinations.

Fuel your childhood nostalgia with craft beers while exchanging dollar bills for quarters.

This place is as addicting as Phils' New Manhattan especially if you're a fan of legendary games such as Marvel vs Capcom or Tekken.
author: Charles M.

description:
Didn't have my laptop with me but was looking for a place to game. Couldn't find any internet gaming cafes so I stubled upon Brewcade.

Had two anchor steams ($6 each) and spent $5 on games. Unlike most other arcade hangouts, all games were in working order. Moderately priced drinks ($10 or less) and great throw-back games earned this place 5 stars from me.
author: David H.

description: I am in love with this bar-cade!  Not only do they have some really awesome old school arcade games but they have a truly expansive beer list. We went on a Saturday night and it was full of a super happy vibe...everyone was laughing and having a great time. I would highly suggest this place for a night out with friends.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Alright, let's start with the common complaints.

Yes, the layout leads to it getting insanely cramped around the cabinets. Yes the beer is slightly pricey (depending on what you order). And yes, some of the cabinets seem to eat quarters (though this may be a misconception: see below).

To the first point, just don't come on a weekend night if you don't want to squeeze past some group in order to play Bust-a-Move. This is much better as a weekday retreat from responsibility and the real world, not a weekend nightlife spot (there are plenty of those within walking distance).

Second, the beer selection is actually pretty good, featuring Bay Area breweries (Fort Point and Berryessa to name a few notables). Do you pay $7 for that pint? Sure. But this is San Francisco, and on the edge of the Castro...wtf do you expect? I'd say the beer selection and pricing are better than most, though to be sure it's no "craft beer bar".

And third, I started to suspect that the cabinets I chose to play (of which there is a good variety) that "ate quarters" did so because most people did not realize they were $.50 to play. Putting one quarter in most of them gives you no sense that you need to put another one in to actually play, so people got frustrated and walked away. Sure, there was one machine I spent $.75 on to play, but everything else seemed to work just fine. Again, this plays back to my first point, don't go on a weekend!

Sure there's no Simpsons, X-Men, or TMNT, but there are plenty of fun cabinets to get your nostalgia going. A few cabinets have multiple games to choose from as well. I'll admit, playing "Willow" as an arcade game wasn't for me, but there's something for everyone, be it puzzle games, platformers, or shooters.

And what makes it even better? A metal holster for your beer next to almost every cabinet, making it a breeze to set your brew down without worry of knocking it over during your spastic, killer combos in Marvel vs Capcom.

Solid four stars. Not the best arcade around, but it delivers on what it promises. Plus, iced Sumptown coffee on nitro?? Hell yes.
author: Jeff R.

description: I love this place! Can't wait to go back. Great bartenders, great beer on tap, great games, everything is just great! I'm not sure if they were serving food. So I would like to go back and really great a better feel for the place. Love that they have installed drink cups and every game. It makes it so much easier to get your gaming on.
author: Skye J.

description:
As three nerds, we went to this place with high expectations. We wanted to drink a couple of beers, and challenge each other in Street Fighter or one of other many games listed. 

We go in to see that it's actually just a bar with a couple of arcade machines pushed to the side. Granted they might bring in more games and change the interior, the arcade side of things seemed like an afterthought. 

What did we play? We tried playing a game (I forgot the name, but basically you're a half naked guy fighting wolves and monsters), and even though the game was supposed to be two-players, it wouldn't allow more than one of us to play. We lost a bunch of quarters trying to get it to work, but nope. 

Oh, and as soon as one of us put some metal song on the jukebox, whoever is running the show decided to just play their own playlists and ignore the dollars spent on the jukebox. 

So we came out thinking we could give it another chance a couple of months down the line, when all the kinks are sorted out. But right there and then, the bouncer told us to not talk right outside the bar because the neighbors complain a lot. Yeah that's gonna be great for your business.
author: Devin O.

description:
When I first heard about Brewcade, I immediately thought of Barcade in Brooklyn, one of my favorite bars EVER. Similar sounding name aside, Brewcade really has to do a bit of work to catch up to the awesomeness that is Barcade. The gaming area is pretty cramped and it's weird basically being butt to butt with other gamers. And while the initial list of games mentioned a few pinball machines there are no pins to be found. One last gripe about the games - it would be neat if they kept a list of top scores (again, like Barcade does)

On the Brew side of things, Brewcade has a great selection of beer and actually a lot of interesting non alcoholic options. I haven't tried the snacks but it's nice that they do have some munchies available and also let you bring food in from the outside. There are plenty of tables to hang out while waiting for games to become available, actually I think they have too many tables. They could easily remove a few tables to spread out the games (or add some pinball!)

Overall, Brewcade is off to a pretty solid start. I've had a lot of fun going during non peak hours but when it's packed, it gets annoyingly crowded. I say if you're a fan of old school games give it a shot some lazy afternoon.
author: phil h.

description: You know what? I'm starting to think that people in SF are getting a little TOO entitled. "Wah they don't have this game or that" You know what's cool? A bar with an awesome beer selection that happens to have video games. Sure, they don't have EVERY beer on tap ever, and they don't have EVERY video game you loved as a kid, but they do have an awesome selection and entertainment! The bartenders here are nice and did not roll their eyes when I asked for recommendations. There's a change machine and serve yourself water as well. What do you snivelly SF sour-pusses want? Oh well, all the more beer and games for me and my crew ;)
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Such a cool concept. Except the games were WAY too close together.  Most of the time my quarters didn't work.  and Not as many games as it sounds.

It still has great beers and a lot of potential but Needs a new layout!
author: Matt C.

description:
I wanted to love Brewcade, but the space is actually too small. The arcade selection was limited and it was difficult to play without first checking your surroundings to make sure you don't bump into or elbow someone.   It made me wish there was a Dave and Busters in the city.

Suggestion:  I think they should have some sort of coat check service or coat hooks or small shelving.  Logistically, it is quite difficult to hold a beer, your jacket, purse (luckily, I have a side bag), your quarters and try to play Bust-a-move.  Some machines had a cup holder, but not all do.
author: Ames L.

description: We had a great time here. What's not to like... great selection of beers and classic arcade games like Donkey Kong, Joust, Paperboy, and Super Mario Brothers. Don't know how to play a game - not to worry, just ask Tony and he'll give you some tips.
author: Dean L.

description: The Brewcade itself is a pretty cool concept. Decent/pretty good selection of beer and old-school arcade games sounds like a good time. But the bartenders are not nice. Not the stereotype Toronado bartender, they are just rude here. I asked about flavor profile and the bartender huffed and puffed and said "well it's an ale." I know...i was hoping for a little more....They won't even let you try a beer before you get it and even on a quiet night they do not greet you until they feel like it. Kind of ruined the experience for me.
author: Zara S.

description: Annoying private parties constantly shut the doors to regular patrons. I like the place and they have a surprisingly good beer list. But 3 times in a row that I tried to go it was closed for a private event. I'm pretty much done.
author: Michael R.

description:
Brewcade has a lot of promise. From the same folks as Blackbird down the street, a lot of people (myself included) were looking forward to a new beer bar. Plus, they would have video games?! Sweet!

While Blackbird has its charm and ambiance, Brewcade is a much more minimal/sterile. The neon greed BREWCADE sign in enchanting at night, I will say, but not much else. There is plenty of space, it seems, for large groups of thirsty gay (?) nerds to gather. It was an odd hour, so the place wasn't full on my visit.

The beer selection is exhausting-- there should be something for everyone. There are some fizzy non-alcoholic things to be had as well. Small snacks are available, and they encourage/allow people to get food from Hecho next-door, or Hi Tops across the street. 

Now, about those games. I will admit that I was salivating at the idea that some of these vintage games would be available, bringing up memories of young Bryan throwing his NES controller across the room, or screaming at Sonic the Hedgehog, or inventing new swear words during heated Pokemon battles. (In fact, maybe I should attribute any rage issues to playing video games.. but I digress...)

The game situation is crowded. Literally. The current configuration has all of the games tucked into a corner in several rows. Most of the games have some sort of beer holder nearby. Since it was slow traffic, we didn't have any elbowing issues, but I could imagine with a larger crowd, it would become downright claustrophobic. Also, if you read the list of arcade games from any news articles, just understand that they will not all be available at once. I was looking forward to reliving my days playing The Simpsons arcade game at the local movie theater-- alas, no such luck on my visit.

All in all, a great addition in terms of a beer hall, but I don't see myself returning just for the games anytime soon.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Like some of the other Yelpers, I was left feeling pretty "meh" about my experience at Brewcade. It's definitely not an awful time, but I think I may have over-hyped it to myself. I've been waiting and waiting for this place to open since reading about it a while ago on Eater. 

On the good:
The service is pretty great. Greeted by a really friendly door guy to check IDs. The bartenders were also really nice, if not slightly overwhelmed by the crowds (there were remnants of Santa Con still around...), but I give 'em a pass--it's opening week!

The space itself is pretty cool--has a fun vibe and they were playing the Hobbit on a really nice TV. Ample seating and places to stand and talk. They have a magnetic wall thing with letter magnets (reminiscent of Q Restaurant that closed in the Richmond) so you can make dirty words. I think I saw "Kinky Elf Sex Porn". Not my thing, but hey, could be hot. 

Bathrooms were clean and had a cool selection of brews.

The meh:
The selection of games listed on the Eater piece seemed crazyyyy long. When I got there, I was pretty shocked to see how few games there were (plus no Simpsons :( Guess everything's not coming up Millhouse just yet...). I guess in my mind, that list seemed to take up a lot more real estate. As others have mentioned, the whole set-up is really weird. The games run parallel to a communal table so there's a lot of traffic going around the games and they're so tightly packed that if you want to watch a friend play a game or play with them, you'd basically have to stand in front of another game, hoping no one else wants to play it. 

That goes for the bathroom as well--thought it was odd to have a shooting game right in front of the entrance to the bathroom. I almost got elbowed in the face a couple times trying to pee after breaking the seal. 

Also, I thought it was it was weird that they have these taps sitting at their bar with no indication of what it actually is. The only way I found their selection was to go through their menu...which just seems to slow things down a bit much (and I imagine might be increasingly difficult if you're drunk). 

The quality of the games for the most part were fine. I do miss, as another Yelper mentioned, the sound aspect. I played and beat the Michael Jackson game, but sadly, all I could hear was a trademark "YEEHEE!" everytime I entered more quarters. Some of the games ate my quarters, and also games that had multiplayer only allowed you to play 1 player. Sad days. 

All in all, I'd still give Brewcade another chance; could just need some time to figure things out a bit more. I'd also say adjust your expectations of having a full-fledged arcade experience to one that's more like a casual drinker/gamer hanging out for happy hour and who may or may not be into kinky elf sex.
author: Patrick W.

description:
A fun place to grab a beer and spend an hour jamming quarters into different machines.

Pros:
-Pac-man
-Good beer
-Nice place

Cons:
-No Tron :(
-Hard to find a menu. It would be a lot easier to order if there was a chalkboard above the bar
-Expensive beer in small cups

Some of the games are in better shape than others, just expect to find some oddities as they are all fairly old games.
author: Andrew H.

description: My wife Linda Had a great time here last night! What more could She ask for, beer and video games! She is a avid Ms Pacman fan and Tony was great showing where the machines were! "Thanks for ur help Tony" ~Linda
author: Mark W.

description:
Brewcade would be a great place to visit even if there were no cool old video games.  Their beer list is one of the best in SF.  

Brewcade would be a great place to visit even if there wasn't a great list of beers.  The video games are just awesome and in good shape.  

Get my point?
author: Nelson W.

description:
Huge potential and I look forward to re-reviewing this place in the future but as of now there are some problems that should be addressed:
 - cabinet controls are in very poor condition.  if they want to attract gamers, start by respecting the games.
 - machines are packed in as closed as physically possible, making it very difficult to stand.  i literally had to stand sideways and play tetris one handed to fit in front of the machine.
 - overhead fans were running full blast on a cold night for some reason?
 - quarter machine was broken on day 1.  surely this will be fixed soon.

The biggest problem by far was that the bouncer was maintaining a line outside even though there were ample seats and tables available inside.  This is a giant middle finger to the patronage and will probably be the deciding factor in whether or not I make this place the regular spot I wish it could be.
author: joe b.

description:
Definitely a bummer. All the games are old and they are going to eat A LOT of your quarters(thank god they are not tokens). Not wanting to hassle the staff constantly to get me my credits I just kinda gave up. All the games are old school which has its place but boredom sets in quick.

Mortal Kombat plz!

I'll be back, but I live down the street.
author: Peter M.

description: Such a fun place for our group of friends! Tony the attendant was awesome! He unlocked a ton of games for us and taught me some of the secret moves on Street Fighter. Also a great selection of beverages and overall a great time. Thank you Brewcade and Tony for making my birthday party awesome.
author: Amber C.

description: Great concept, although the Barcades in NY have already set the bar higher with all games being 25 cents and the use of tokens. At Brewcade, one machine ate my quarters (though the bartender was nice enough to replace them), the games aren't clearly marked about how much they cost and which slots to use, and it's super cramped in here. Nice that they had the Anchor Christmas brew though.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Came in at 6:20pm yesterday (the bar was open, there were customers) but no one was manning the bar-- there was no bartender, nor any employees around.  We stood there for 5-10 minutes hoping someone would show up for work and serve us some drinks.  But no one did.
author: Ulysses L.

description: This is San Francisco's smaller version of New York's Barcade or Portland's Ground Kontrol. Most unique game here? Killer Queen.
author: Gordon M.

description: Cool bar. Tony was really nice and showed us the games we wanted. Lots of sour beers:)
author: La W.

description:
This place has a LOT of potential, but I have to say I was kind of underwhelmed. The atmosphere is kind of lackluster. There was an overall feeling of blandness. Maybe the beer taps just needed their actual decorative taps. Besides the awesome BREWCADE sign, there wasn't anything on the walls and it fell kind of flat.

The game selection was definitely for people older than me (and I'm in my late 20s). Maybe I wanted to see Cruisin USA, House of the Dead, Time Crisis, even pinball. Just something a little more eye-popping and "wow, I totally used to play this." Maybe kudos to them for not including those games, and keeping the appeal slim.

I didn't like that they only had beer and wine. Prices were fair though. The menu was average.

Unless they ramp up their game, I'll be passing it up for HECHO and Hi Tops.
author: Adam K.

description:
This is a review-in-progress...

I've been to Brewcade a few times and have found it pretty chill so far.

The good:
-Joe the bartender.
-Atmosphere is fun.
-Good beer list.

The meh:
-The layout is not great for people trying to play the very few arcade games in the back. Definitely a disappointment given the hype.
-Expensive beer in tiny glasses.

Overall, a sweet place to hang out when it's not busy, but not worth a trip out of your way.
author: Kat F.

description:
Came here on Wednesday night which I believe was the actual opening night, after their "soft opens".

The wide selection of craft beers are tasty.  Seems to favor Belgians and IPAs.  In addition, there are tasty pub eats.

I was pretty excited for this place given the online hype and arcade list.  As other reviewers have pointed out most don't have discernible volume, a lot of cabinets were not present yet (Simpsons), and some of the cabinets were defective (Moonwalker & SNK cabinet in the back). 

As someone else pointed out, the layout is also questionable   Intentionally cramming people seems to be the goal.  I would flip-flop the lower tables at the entrance with the BuckHunter game near the restroom and a few other cabinets to alleviate congestion. 

Lastly - I would go back after awhile to have them work out the opening kinds.  In addition, I left my card here and literally cannot find a phone number for this place to call them.  Minus one star.
author: Peter C.

description: Cute concept, okay priced beer. If you are ever in The Castro, it's a cool spot to check out.
author: Esther P.

description:
I went here the other day for a friend's birthday party, and it was really fun. I wish they had hard alcohol, but I know how hard/expensive that is to obtain. The games were really fun. There were some broken ones, including mario, which broke my heart. I ended up playing galaga (my favorite) all night. The atmosphere was great, and the bartenders were really nice and knowledgable. 
I'd go back for another friend's birthday.
author: Sami B.

description: Bouncer was starting fights with people who were waiting outside. Maybe the establishment is okay, but the man working the front door was absolutely unprofessional.
author: Casey C.

description: Games could be better but the pinball makes up for it. Good selection of board games too. The standards anyway....and great beer!
author: Danny and Christina M.

description:
I visited SF to spend NYE with some friends. After debating what to do and where to go we decided to bail on an overpriced party and opted for the promise of Brewcade. 

Ordering beer was a social experience. I got to know the bartenders and we talked about their selection and what I thought sounded good in the moment. 

After getting my first beer I set out to play some games. There were some games from my childhood that I didn't find, but I had a damn good time learning Donkey Kong Jr.  

At midnight there was a countdown and hundreds of balloons fell from the ceiling. It was a nice touch. 

All and all I will definitely stop back in the next time I'm in town. Thanks for a great NYE experience!
author: Zane C.

description:
Brewcade is awesome on paper: a stellar beer selection and the lure of old-school arcades. In practice, though, Brewcade is a cramped, sweaty bar with a "meh" selection of games. 

The layout causes most of my issues. Arcades are on top of one another, and the table placement creates narrow alleys to move around the space. This results in bumping into people left and right and a bottleneck at the bar ... not enjoyable in the slightest. The place also smells like my old fraternity house, and most of the games are pretty obscure for me (and I'm a child of the 90s).

To the positive, the beer selection is quite great, and there are a few enjoyable games (for me, that's Frogger, Paperboy, and Buck Hunt, when there isn't a line at each). But on a Friday/Saturday night, I'm looking elsewhere.
author: Matt T.

description:
good lord, this place was ridiculously crowded on a Saturday night. I couldn't even get to the video games. I will not be back, unfortunately. I enjoy video games/pinball machines & drinks! I thought it would be a winning combo, but the crowd here was just awful. Not so much the capacity of people, but the content. Marina South. NONE of which were playing games, just standing in the way and giving snarky looks when I attempted to play them.

Go to Lucky 13 instead. No attitude, no douche bags & a couple of pinball machines upstairs with ample room to put your drink down & actually play a game.
author: Amber G.

description: My friends and I popped in after hearing all the hype and we were underwhelmed.  Considering this place is owned by the peeps of Blackbird, I had high hopes as Blackbird is a cool bar.  You can definitely see the cost cutting in the materials and design of the bar.  It has a minimalism similar to Hecho.  The only redeeming feature are the pipes on the wall above the bar and that is kinda cool.  This place was hyped up for the video game/arcade feature and.... I find myself a little underwhelmed with it.  They have a ton of beers on tap which is great.  However, I haven't found one that I like.  Unless friends want to go there, I don't see myself seeking it out on my own or suggesting it.  It's unlikely that'll happen as my friends seem to be on the same page in that the place is just underwhelming.  Nothing bad, just........ nothing wow.
author: Shaun W.

description:
Strong on-tap coffee.

Video game at bar, on big screen.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Wow wow wow. Love this spot. Wine slushies and cute bartenders, can you ask for a better place in the Castro?! 

Good ambiance but not so loud that you can't hear your friends!  Cool space, love the high ceilings and neat layout. Also the still and sparkling water on tap is a nice touch. 

Went with a gaming friend and he freaked out about Killer Queen, not sure what it is but apparently it's a big deal! 

Would recommend this place to friends, co-workers or even for a first date spot.
author: Alex N.

description: Brewcade has an awesome selection of beer and are the only bar in California that has Killer Queen,  a 10 player arcade game. I come here all the time and everyone feels welcomed here.
author: Rusteen H.

description:
In a world where people dance upon light-up squares to gain points in songs that they don't even like, one bar had the strength to stand up and say "8-bit is Best!" 

Never had I realized that Ms. PacMan gave the much desired opportunity to play a video game and hold my beer at the same time! Are you sick of playing a game that requires both hands and no room to drink? Do you remember a world where small dinosaurs used color-matching marbles to stop the ceiling from falling on their heads? Did you memorize Chun-Li's shoulder toss combination?

This is the bar for you! Finally, there is a place that combines the joy of crafted beers and games with the flare and color of the arcade from Tron!
author: Andrew W.

description: This place may smell bad but, it's pretty damn cool. Such a blast to the past with these games. Except then I couldn't drink. Now, drinking makes losing at Frogger and Paperboy that much easier.
author: Mark G.

description: I like the idea of old school arcades and a good time with friends and this is a pretty chill spot. Drinks are a little overpriced but it is a good environment for a fun and chill nights that bring back childhood memories. Will be back.
author: Q W.

description: This place was the raddest. Went with a friend, played all their fighting games, their racing game, and a MICHEAL JACKSON THEMED BEAT UM UP where you kill people with dance and turn into a robot. They make a peach wine slushy that's wonderful. Would go again.
author: Daniel B.

description: You would think that a bar + arcade combo would be way cooler than this, but unfortunately Brewcade just falls short. The beer selection is sort of limited, but decent. The games themselves are clearly targeting a specific demographic, which is fine, but it's seriously so cramped in there, no one can play games next to one another.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Great place. I hope it does well. There is a huge beer selection, some quite expensive. I got a $5 Saison farm ale I really liked.

The games are well maintained. There are many single game machines, and a few multimode ones. Many of my all-time favorites were present, and I really enjoyed playing them. My one frustration was that the Defender on the multimode had a bit of an unorthodox layout I couldn't quite get used to. However, games on the multimode that have a more conventional control scheme were just great - e.g. Joust, Robotron (yay!).

The have a Street fighter II Turbo edition (the one true version if you ask me) that is in fantastic shape.

A special treat was the co-op 15th anniversary edition of Dig Dug. I was a big fan of the original, and this is a very fun variant, particularly for co-op play.

The employees were friendly and likable. The owner really knows his stuff about games. 

One piece of constructive criticism - the coin slots are kinda hard to see. I understand getting the coin slot lights working is less important than maintaining the games themselves, but maybe there's an easy way to improve this (paint around the slots, some sort of subtle floor lighting?)

There's great 70's and 80's music playing on the jukebox. Shooting robots with "Brick House" playing in the background takes me back. All-in-all, a wonderful experience. I'm sure I'll be back.
author: Carter S.

description:
A must visit for beer and classic arcade game nerds a like. It is a bit crowded around the gaming area, as someone else mentioned, though in some ways I think it may add to the classic arcade feel. Beer selection was good (even had a great sour on tap which always wins points for me), and the girl working (I wish I had asked her name!) was very knowledgeable and helpful.

We went on a Saturday afternoon so it wasn't insanely packed, but we were told that it gets crazy at night. I'm definitely a fan of this place! They have plenty of classic staples as far as games: Joust, Track &  Field, 1942, R-Type, Pac Man, Mario, a few multi-cades with things like Burger Time and Puzzle Bobble on them...basically, just go check it out.
author: Sara S.

description: Awesome arcade games, good beer selection, and solid atmosphere. Only downside is it gets a bit crowded, so you may end up waiting for the games you want to play.
author: ben r.

description: I'm not really sure how one could go wrong with an arcade that serves alcohol. The vibe was friendly there and the bartender was also super nice. Also love the self serve water near the magnet board with alphabet letters to play with, which speaking of magnet boards is also an entertaining way to spend your time there if you're not so into Donkey Kong..
author: Katie N.

description: Compared to adult arcades in Philly and Chicago this place is subpar. Limited selection of games, tight space, and in typical sf fashion the games are more expensive!
author: Jason W.

description: Our gaming clan decided to meet up here since it was new.  If you're a craft beer fanatic, you will love their huge selections.  If you're a gamer, depending what era you're from, the selection in video games are limited to stuff that span during the early 80s.  I mean, some of these games are a little "too old" for us and we're not spring chickens either.  Not only the game selections are limited, but they're also a quarter or 50 cents to play!  Inflation is a b-tch!
author: Huy N.

description: Every single game I tried ate my quarters. Staff was basically  not interested, but maybe that's not their problem. I give it a meh.
author: Sandy M.

description: Pretty cool spot. It has lots of arcade games (Killer Queen is cool if you have a big group) and great beer selection. It was a bit tight when I was here on a Friday night but hey that is city life y'all. I would come back!
author: James B.

description: Staff is EXTREMELY rude. They called last call so I bought my last beer. I set the beer down next to me (which was still completely full- I hadn't even taken a sip from it) and was talking to a friend. Less than 5 minutes after I bought the beer, one of the bartenders came by, took my completely full drink, poured it out and said we needed to leave because the bar was closing. I said that I just bought that beer a few minutes ago and asked why they would sell me a beer if they were just about to close. The guy told me that the bartender would not have sold me the beer so late in the night. I then went over to the bartender with him and asked her to confirm that she just sold it to me but she wouldn't respond. Then 3 other bartenders came around me and started yelling at me telling me that it was my fault for setting the drink down on the table. They did not need 4 males to surround me (a small girl) and yell at me, which was honestly pretty scary and aggressive- when the only thing I did wrong was buy a drink at last call. I was so upset and shaken after this I decided to just leave and give up. I will NEVER let come back here and have told my friends to not come here because of the extremely rude and aggressive staff. This is not a way to treat a customer.
author: Katie T.

description: Very pretentious and arrogant bartender. Also a lot of the games had broken joysticks. Other than that cool concept. I hope they get better. 2 stars maybe 2 and a half.
author: Kelly T.

description: This place is amazing, lots of great arcade games and amazing beers. Also, you can't leave without playing Killer Queen! You won't regret it. Andrew has been bartending the past two times I've been there and this guy is a beast! He was handling a full bar all by himself and I've gotta give him mad props. Go say what's up to him if you see him.
author: Christian H.

description:
Made my first and last visit here last night.  A friend and I thought it would be a good place to get a beer before dinner at Hecho. 

The service was so bad my friend and I kept confirming with each other that it was as bad as it seemed. 

Place was empty. Once we sat at the bar there were a total of 6 customers.  It appeared the bartender was friends with another couple at the bar and talking to them was more important than helping us. 

The 3 main issues were #1 We sat ready to order for several minutes. #2 My friend drinks non-alcoholic beer and they have no options for that and then the final straw was after I finally was able to order my beer, the bartender stood at the taps for 5 minutes twirling my glass in his hands while talking with his friends.

This was the point we just got up and left.

Based on me telling friends about this experience and them telling me they're hearing the same thing from others, I don't see much of a shelf life for this place. 

With all the choices and options, why businesses don't focus more on service and giving people a reason to want to come back is a mystery to me.  Especially when a bartender would know he's never served someone before.  Do better at making people feel welcomed.
author: Bill L.

description: I noticed things were a bit different when I walked by, so I went in.  The machines are spread out now, so you can play without being crowded.  They have two change machines and they have added pinball machines.  Much improved.
author: Bay G.

description: Had a good time here . There were beers and old school arcade games . There wasn't that big of a selection, maybe 30, but they also had pinball and a great 5vs5 game called Queen Bee. It's also next to a couple of other great restaurants and bars
author: Nick M.

description:
Really digging this place, it's nice to have another bar on the 37 line to belly up to while waiting for the ever undependable bus to roll through. The smoked bear and sour are my early favs, as are anything from Hen house brewery. haven't starting going through the wine selection yet, but although this place is beer and wine (and snack like jerky and chips and nuts) only, they have a fun little menu of "cocktails" featuring their beer or wine. Pop in and say hey to Kishanti, dude knows his stuff and has been very helpful showing me some and delicious brews. They also take credit/debit cards, which is quite welcome in this often cash-only-bar city.

oh, and they have a bunch of rad arcades, if that wasn't obvious.
author: Andy H.

description: This place is perfect.  Great beer selection, nice staff and people to boot AND GAMES LIKE YOU WOULDNT BELIEVE
author: Scott H.

description: This is a great addition to the hood! Love that there's a ton of gluten free options with decent alcohol percentages cuz y'all know my priorities lol. Prices are reasonable but I think the gaming selection could be better. I'd love to see some air hockey and skeeball additions even though they're not technically arcade games. I'd also be down for some other classics like Q-bert, Toejam & Earl, and Sonic the Hedgehog. It's a good place to have a mellow time and chill.
author: Jill D.

description: Tekken was super fun - the other games not as much for sure... Love the broad selection of beer but the wine slushy was pretty nasty :)
author: Mariya L.

description: They have the perfect music to take a dump to and the rest rooms are nice and clean. They have a few varieties of beers which is good and they have a variety of don't take because they have you for a few variety of beers which is cool.
author: George G.

description: While in Portland I checked out a similar place called Ground Kontrol. It was amazing. Filled with 90s video games (Simpsons, X-Men, DDR, etc), beer, and a great atmosphere. When I heard SF had something similar I was really excited. To sum it up Brewcade is not a good arcade nor is it a particularly good bar. Not many good games and the drinks seemed a bit on the expensive side.
author: Andrew D.

description: I'm a huge fan of arcade games and beer. So, for me, Brewcade is an easy goto spot after work. The staff are super nice, the beer selection is great, and they have tons of games (including 4 different versions of Ms. Pacman). Pro tip: This is a great place to grab quarters for your laundry.
author: Matt S.

description: What a piece of crap. I recently made a trip to LA and loved EightyTwo, a well designed arcade bar with lots of space, all the classic games (for the classic price of just a quarter) and plenty of pinball. Brewcade is classic San Francisco - over priced hype. What are these games they have? They are terrible and 80% of them I've never heard of before. What's worse is that the games cost fifty cents, which discourages playtime, and some eat your quarters. Most of the patrons are standing around talking about what a cool place this is but they aren't even playing the games. Sure, there is a decent selection of beer on draft, but that has become the standard for most SF establishments that in itself isn't worth the draw. The space is tight and poorly designed. It was worth it to check out but not interesting enough to stick around.
author: Anthony S.

description: Eh. Decent place for a beer but the arcade experience is disappointing. Fifteen minutes before closing, one of the employees killed a four-person game of pinball on the third ball. Not cool.
