author: Sean A.

description: You know that feeling of excitement buildup prior to opening that Xmas present then the wash of apathy the ensues: socks (channeling A Christmas Story Movie). Wanted to like this place and we did, but the novelty wore off quickly. Plenty of beer selections (big plus here!) but not much in the way of cocktails. Bring bills less than $20s since the change machine takes up to tens. Filled with guys that can probably write the code of these games on their phone.
author: Vivial S.

description: Very fun place to hang out, play video games, and have a beer. Great selection of local craft beers. Can get crowded around 10pm. Great atmosphere, great service.
author: Mark L.

description:
So here's the deal. I want to give this place 5-stars but as of Day 1, they are only 3. I will certainly check out this place as it evolves over the next few months but here's the rundown for all of those interested in checking it out. I want to be candid here so expectations are clear.

Pros:
* Nice, big space and plenty of tables and seating
* Good selection of beer & wine
* Nice bouncers and bartenders

Cons:
* No hard alcohol which could be considered a Pro too...
* Quarter machine was out of order so it was a hassle for both customers and bartenders to constantly have to give/receive quarters. Waste of time and money for both parties
* Only 15 or so cabinets. No pinball for all you pinball enthusiasts.
* Those 15 cabinets are mostly filled by knock-off cabinets. What I mean by that is 5 or so of the cabinets are PC cabinet emulators that have 50 or so games to choose from. It's nice, in terms of selection, but loses the sense of nostalgia and accomplishment. Nostalgia is what's drawing people here but they fail pretty badly in retaining that sense of nostalgia. There's only a few REAL, authentic cabinets.
* Cabinets eat quarters like crazy! Fortunately, they were nice enough to refund the ridiculous amount of quarters eaten.
* Cabinets are squeezed together so there's not a whole lot of room to play. There was much bumping and drink-spilling due to the compact area around the cabinets.
* Joysticks and buttons are terrible. There will be plenty of frustration from stuck buttons or non-responseive josysticks...
* Here's the biggest issue with this place - MOST GAMES ARE $.50 A PLAY...I'm not trying to be cheap here but the fact that i have to play 8-bit JOUST or Tetris or Pac-man for $.50 is a bit ridiculous. Again, nostalgia is important in keeping people coming back but having to pay inflated prices for these games, kills that sense of nostalgia even more.

This has HUGE potential to be a great place and somewhere I would go on the regular. They just need to find a way to stop trying to make money off of their cabinets and increase their opportunity to sell drinks. Full liquor license is inevitably coming so that should help. Cabinets are expensive, but if they can get authentic ones, they'll be better in the long-run.

Like I said earlier, I went Day 1 so there will certainly be some hiccups. I know things will get ironed out so I'm excited to see what comes.
author: Tommy P.

description: Went here for a friend's birthday. It was fun. There are lots of fun arcade games we played as kids. I also really enjoyed the pinball games. I will be going back! The only problem is that you can't be too loud when you are outside the bar because of the residents. Which really doesn't make too much sense. If you're at a bar, loud noises are kinda expected. We didn't appreciate being shushed by the residents at 8:30pm. Still had fun though.
author: Tali N.

description: Tony (attendant) is awesome. Played Frogger and reminisced about childhood. Lots of beer choices. A good spot for a group to hang out and exercise their competitive juices.
author: Emily M.

description: somewhat disappointing , however i do have high standards when it comes to #barcades, i hold these places to Chicago standards #headquarters #emporium
author: Dre P.

description:
I LOVE Brewcade. I've been here several times and it's a blast. Fun atmosphere, great games, and tasty drinks!

I would definitely try the wine slushy drink too. But be careful, it's deceptively strong :)
author: Jonathan S.

description: Went here for the first time last night and had a blast! Having played videos games maybe 3 times in my life, Tony the attendant was super helpful. Homeboy knew his stuff and helped us pick awesome games all night.
author: M N.

description:
Great location. In general the bar is a fun place.

The good: Not packed, no massive lines for the games, fun retro game selection, great beer variety

The bad: Some machines are pretty janky (bad joysticks, unresponsive buttons, blocked coin slots, eaten coins), very expensive beers, many emulator-based machines as opposed to original cabinets, pretty loud.

I would absolutely go back. Brewcade is unique and fun, which makes it a gem. If they address some of the problems listed, it is entirely possible that this joint could be a 5.
author: Chris P.

description:
Some classic arcade games in a fairly tight space. I lost two quarters to the slot in one machine where the coins got jammed but the barkeeper compensated me for them. This was at around 3pm or 4pm when the bar was not that busy. They have a change machine for quarters. A solid 4 stars.

Some Yelpers are complaining because their favourite games are not available. This seems a bit unfair as there is a wide selection of games. There are a small number of machines, probably 10-20, but some machines have multiple games installed, particularly the Neo Geo beast which has a *lot* of classic 90s games that I remember skipping church to play (read: "old"). It would be great if they listed their collection online though http://www.brewcadesf.com/our_games does not currently do so. 

The selection includes: i) games with simple mechanics like Bombjack, Joust, Dig Dug, and Frogger; ii) games which have wide appeal like Puzzle Bobble; iii) vertical scrollers like 1942s and Moon Crestas; iv) platformers like Super Mario Bros, the Donkey Kong games, and Willow; v) shoot-em-ups like Metal Slug; vi) many, many beat-em-ups and slash-em-ups on the Neo Geo; vii) soccer games... You get the idea; enthusiasts and non-gamers alike should find something to enjoy.

Given the choice between arcade games and beer, I'm a dedicated button masher so I can't comment on their selection of cold ones.
author: Shane O.

description: My favorite bar in San Francisco.  The Michael Jackson "Moonwalker" game is the best.  The beer selection is good, though I do wish they had more cocktails.  Still, I'd choose this over almost any other bar in SF.
author: Ryan S.

description:
As you can see, I don't write reviews. At all. However, I will for this place. The beer is great with a wide selection and the location is easy to find and big. They had one of my favorite saisons, saison du pont, which was pretty cool. The arcade games are nostalgic and fun, but what sets this place apart from other arcade bars is the cabinet with multiple arcade games inside. What I mean by this is inside the cabinet is a motherboard that holds multiple ROMs to choose from, with an easy to use selection screen and when I say multiple ROMs, I mean over 500 different games in just one cabinet. 512 to be exact. Their selection ranges from SEGA to NAMCO to CAPCOM to NEO-GEO. HUGE selection. I was oozing with nostalgia when I got to choose from any of my childhood arcade games. If you like classic arcade games, you gotta go to this place. If you like a wide selection of craft, local, and imported European beer, you gotta go to this place. 

A few suggestions: I was told that some people have a hard time figuring out how to use this cabinet, which I can understand. It's pretty self explanatory, but my first impression of it I thought it was a street fighter cabinet. I think if they put like a sign that says like over 500 games in one above the cabinet it would be easier to understand what it is. Also, make the instructions on how to use the cabinet more visible. The lighting in the place is dim, and the instructions are right below the screen in very small font. Because this is also a bar I can totally understand people who are a little tipsy to not read or look down at the instructions. Aside form that, it's great.
author: Chris G.

description: 3 beers = 33$ tip not included .......beyond whack, bring a flask play video games #nostalgic i guess
author: Johnny B.

description:
Great spot! Took my department here for a team outing and had a great time. Everyone loved it! Shawn and the bartenders were wonderful to work with and flexible to accommodate our needs. Great game selection and great beer offerings! 

We will be back! Thank you!
author: Loretta R.

description:
Was excited for this as a new option in the neighborhood, but had the life sucked out of me as soon as I entered last night. The music was awful. Completely lifeless space, and boring crowd. The guys looked like the type of dork in their 30's who has never kissed a girl--and they're straight.  

And the Donkey Machine was broken.
author: Jeff F.

description: Great place. Had a happy hour here with my company. Had a few drinks and a great time playing older arcade classics. Only complaint is that its too crowded to go behind people to get to other machines when the place gets super busy. Would honestly take out the booths and put in smaller, standup tables in order to get that extra needed space. Great manager who pointed out where one of the games we were hoping they had was (Sunset Riders).
author: Sean C.

description: The beer was good. However, the layout is terrible and the crowd was a little too basic for me. After two beers, I had to leave because I needed a little more stimulation than some old arcade games that I definitely would not waste my quarters on. Make them a nickel and fix the layout...that could help.
author: Michael H.

description: I'm disappointed with the bar tender more than anything else. I would suggest coming during the day when you can play board games, and arcade games your hearts content. And the beer is fabulous. It's too bad the tall black bar tender with a shaved head and dreadlocks was the worst bar tender  and not very nice at all.
author: Jennie M.

description: Where do I start! This place is everything a guy can want beer, video games and food from hi tops.  Points off for not having all the beer on the menu
author: Pawel K.

description:
Very let down by the lack of games and pretty poor selection of the ones they have. With Brewcade as the title I was expecting far more. This place doesn't touch any of the game bars in Portland or Denver for example. 

Aside from that the bar itself and drink selection is pretty solid. But again the games were supposed to be the differentiator and they are meh to poor.
author: P C.

description: Even though it isn't purple, try the grape drank--its slushy meets wine. What a great concept!
author: Arvind R.

description: They have BurgerTime! That game speaks for itself! Great atmosphere to be a kid and an adult at the same time. Definitely coming back!
author: Michael V.

description:
Incredible draft selection that is larger than the selection available at most good bars and is better quality than you can find just about anywhere. Obscure drafts, reliable go-to brews, all around delicious. It was hard to make a decision because of all the great options.

Good selection of arcade games, space is laid out nicely. Plenty of room to sit down or stand. Excited to check it out when it is a bit less crowded to get more game time in. My new watering hole!
author: L M.

description: STOP IT with your not 5 stars meanies. This place is the bomb. Frozen champagne delight? What ? Whaaaat? Brynna behind the bar? Whawhat??? ARCADE games of the OLD SCHOOL stature? Check yourself four stars and below.
author: Laura P.

description: if you love old games like bust a move by taito, you can play it here while drinking beers on draft, gluten free omission beer in bottles, frozen slushy wine, hitachino nest, lots of great options.  if arcade games don't interest you, you can also play board games or the boxing game!
author: Wakako U.

description: I'm not really into arcade games, but I had fun here.  They are still trying to figure things out as the bar is super new.  The bar tenders are not seasoned, but are very sweet and attentive.  I love that they have a lot of seating and that you are able to order food from other places and eat there. I recently spent a Saturday night there playing card at a corner table. FUN! Also, they have a great selection of sodas, if you don't feel like beer or wine.
author: Skye W.

description: Some good beer, but I would call the atmosphere anything to write home about. They also have wine on tap - that was a nice option to have.
author: Nathaniel H.

description: Kai has done an amazing job with this space!  Solid draft list, service with a smile, and totally awesome classic arcade games for 50 cents a play!  Not to mention it's a huge space.  I've been waiting for something like this to pop up in Duboce. As an added bonus you can even order food from Hi-Tops across the street.
author: Natasha K.

description: I love this place. Nothing better than brews and games. The space is a little small and it gets pretty crowded in there. Also, there never seem to be enough bartenders. But overall, can't say no to this place. Beers and retro arcade games? I'm down.
author: Eric C.

description: I found this bar to take my boyfriend to while we were visiting SF. He loves his video games and classic arcade games. When we walked in were were immediately excited to see a Mario Kart tournament being projected on the screen above the bar. They have a huge beer selection and a good variety of classic arcade games: frogger, pac man, donkey kong, centipede, to name a few. The bar was not over crowded when we went so we could walk right up and play any game we wanted. Definitely a great place to grab a few beers and play some games.
author: Dana B.

description: They have DONKEY KONG. Old school donkey kong!!! This is not the place for the new school, these are the games of the arcades when they still existed. And fresh, local brews on tap. We came for a work happy hour and left way too late to be productive at work the next day. And you've got to try the Purple Drank. It's pure class pouring out of that slushy machine.
author: Megan B.

description:
Eh. I really expected more arcade games or at least some board games or something. There are about 10 arcade games. The line gets long and the machines eat quarters. 

The beer selection is good though...
author: A K.

description: Glad my friend brought us here, because I do like trying new things, but I can't see myself going back willingly. The beer selection is decent, if on the pricey side. I like the big, frosty, glass mugs they serve in. I'm lukewarm on the beercade concept; it's a great idea, but not really my thing. What pushes this review down a star is the unfriendly service. The bartender's disdain of our party was visible (he had the look of a freshly drenched cat) from the moment we sat down, I suppose because we weren't three young hotties, but people who were as classic as some of the arcade games. I guess that's what I get for being old. If you're Too Cool for School, you will probably love this place.
author: Joe V.

description: The beer selection & nostalgic atmosphere is awesome! Snacks, old school video games & especially the great wine on tap are amongst my favs here.
author: Kahele C.

description:
This place is a GEM and I think that a lot of people who reviewed don't understand what a barcade should be like (since they haven't been legal very long in California as well, which is fair).

Growing up in Chicago, I have been to my fair share of barcades and this was definitely my absolute favorite! Yes, the machines are close together (the more the merrier as far as I'm concerned), yes, sometimes they jam or are out of order, this is normal and what happens when you have tons of amazing old arcade games! 

"Videogame Bob" has been in the industry for a while and was super helpful anytime we had a question or a machine jam.

Most of the cabinets are modded to play 200+ games including Mario Bros, Donkey Kong, and PacMan! I played up to level 20 on the new 50th Anniversary PacMan game with my friend and we had a blast!

I will be back for sure in the near future and am telling all my gamer friends to check it out because I know this place won't disappoint! :)
author: Suzie R.

description: Great video games and beer selection. The atmosphere is good if you like house music over the sounds of the pinball games and arcade games. My beef is that the bartender went out of his way to ignore my friend and I. We were asked what we wanted, and we needed a few more minutes to decide. He helped some other customers who were ready (as expected), but then other newly arriving patrons would step up right next to us and he would help them first (I'd say 10+ people, or 20-25 mins.). It was painfully obvious he was concentrating so much attention on not serving us or looking at us. When he finally begrudgingly asked us what we would like, he took our money too. He served about five other people before bringing back our change (still no beer). My friend finally got his beer. Then the bartender was greeting friends and chatting with some other patrons for another 10+ minutes, before I had to specifically ask where my beer was. I suppose not having our minds made up about what we wanted to drink immediately, offended him to no end. Since he was attempting to give us the worst service ever, I must commend him for a job very well done.
author: Jeff J.

description: One star for the beer, one star because I guess I'm in a good mood, minus a zillion stars for terrible-condition and overpriced gaming units too packed right together to even use, plus no sound?!?! Instead lame techno house music? Weird crowd. Annoying bouncer. Indifferent bartenders. Uncomfortable seats. I dunno. High hopes but no luck. Wah wah.
author: Clark L.

description: When I arrived I was very happy to see some of my childhood favorite games such as Rally, 1945, Dig Dug, etc... The excitement worn off as my quarters were being eaten and games not working. One after another, every game I tried to play ate my quarters and didn't work. I really wanted to play. Very disappointing.
author: Y G.

description: Good beer and fun games.  But not a fan of the layout.  The tables in the center really make it hard to get around the bar.
author: J E.

description: This place is quite cool and this stretch of market is really picking up. Good for large groups and copious drinking. Only downside is that the games seem more like a gimmick than a feature... I wish they were free (or at least have a working change machine).
author: Sandra S.

description: Great selection of beers! Pricey though..  Had fun playing the games. Nostalgic. Hope they increase there playlist. Some arcades in chicago charge a little more for booze but the games are free.. cool concept..  Smelled like bleach when walking in... yuck.. Bartender handed me wrong ATM card... aggravating. No legit phone number either for establishment... Had to trek back across town to pick mine up. Hey! Since I had to spend money to cab it down how about a beer on the house? I sure was thirsty..  Would of been better than a "sorry about that".  Pfftt.. Small industry.. take care of your customers.. specially if you mess up. Many of us are bartenders, servers and managers at other places. Not the way I would of handled the situation. And yes I do take some responcibility for not looking at my card when it was handed to me. But the trust is on you when I hand you my source of payment. Anyways... thanks for a fun time. I will be back. ;)
author: Daniel M.

description: As a consumer I was very satisfied with this establishment. I went for the first time on a Friday night and they even had the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles movie playing on the big screen, classic! I feel that since classic coin arcade machines are the selling niche for this place, a well stocked change machine is key for it, which this place totally has. Never did i have to worry about the dreaded orange light like from the laundromat. You're not going to be able to enjoy your beer if you have to keep bothering the bartender for more quarters. Second was management of machines. I actually like how there is a staff member who goes around and directs people on beverage placement for the machines. It shows they care about the machines and as a fan of these select classic titles, I want just as much care shown to them. Now granted their selection is limited which I know they get flack for, but they did have some good ones like joust. Felt like they cheated a bit with the emulator arcade shell, but overall I think is a success on this take of a barcade theme as it would be easy to mess up on. Bar setting feels slightly on the trendy side making the bar and gaming area feel separated. I would have liked to see more a design blend where the bar has more an arcade feel to it, but I guess they wouldn't want drunk people trying to put quarters in the keg fridges. Easy public transport access, will be back again!
author: Sanger S.
